ru4j6IRVb5RnwmUI6WOoHQ.text: Everyone was so attentive when we walked in and were sat down at a table right away! Our waiter was extremely nice and made sure our drinks were never empty. The food was great as well, we will definitely be back!!

1UBnGPH9wKxYW-4q5QCMlg.text: Cute restaurant, first impression is positive..   Took long time to get menus Hard unripened avocados on burgers Very good cheese curds and dipping sauce  "Juices flowing" margarita delish if there's no hair in it - had 2 what appeared to be eyelashes in mine Forgot cheese I ordered on vegan burger Farmers daughter burger - cook forgot avocado  Egg was grossly undercooked on burger.. White was runny.. Lost appetite Want to give good review but needs to much improvement to in good conscience be able to :( Very good sweet potato fries - great w/ honey mustard Nice outdoor seating-  but flies were terrible!!!

MOCnD-jGDn_HzV1Q7VXRZQ.text: Best burgers in Charlotte. Period. Also really cool environment with great staff. Highly recommend.

qBS8sEviFqCLHDtuptZJSw.text: Every time I've been the Burgers are great, the Peter piper is where it's at.  Always great.  Beer is mainly local and includes wooden robot and legal remedy, both great!  The cheese curds have gone downhill since the last time I went.  Being from Wisconsin I consider myself somewhat of an unofficial expert on these.  The latest trip the cheese, what little there was of it, was over shadowed by all the extra fried dough.  Half the basket was just the fried dough instead of curds.  If this is their new recipe than I'm gonna have to pass from now on.

lndNKtOMtkOFnol6KvkoUQ.text: Fantastic place. It was crowded but we git a seat finally. Burgers were tasty .... the truffle fries are delicious. Couldn't eat them all. The homemade sauces are basty. Just do ketchup.

wNbzHjgN3R65aRi-UBIVcQ.text: Drinks are weak so make sure you go hungry. Also, the waitress just asked me to borrow the ketchup.

7g838LGFaEE25m4Eiw4O5A.text: Fantastic Large Marge! This Bloody Mary did not disappoint ! Great service by Jessie!. My guy and I went for brunch on a Sunday. The jalapeno poppers w pimento cheese and wrapped in perfectly crisp bacon was fantastic ! We also had the pretzels with the beer cheese - good too! My boyfriend had the burger with the egg on it which was perfectly cooked ( both the egg and the burger ) - was super tasty! I munched on the meal that was in my bloody! Then took a 2 hour nap later on! We will be back!!

f5IKHA_z6390TfEuJHz56A.text: Popped in for a late lunch. It was pretty empty so we were seated quickly. Service was very friendly and prompt. Pickled fried green tomatoes was our starter. Came with plenty enough for a table of 4 to munch on while you wait for your main meal. I ordered the Wild Alaskan Salmon burger with the skinny bun option with Rosemary truffle fries as a side. Plenty to share with a buddy too. Ended up taking most of the fries to go. Lots of flavor in everything I ordered and good portions. There is also a few vegan options!

UJ05OacPT9qtYVk6m7i09w.text: Wow! I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised with how good this place was.  First off, service was exceptional. The hostess was friendly & informative. Our waitress was prompt and stopped by to check on us often.   We ordered the jalapeno bacon firecrackers to start. We make a similar version at home. They were good but SO hot my mouth was on fire for too long. I did like how crispy the bacon was. Next time I'll opt for the brew cheese & pretzels.   I ordered the Rocket Turkey burger on a whole wheat bun with a side of fries. Honestly the best turkey burger I've had. It wasn't, like many I've had, a frozen patty but was actually ground turkey, farm raised at that! The combination of goat cheese, arugula, roasted red peppers, & balsamic fig spread was amaaazing. Will definitely order again. The fries were just how I like them, crisp but not burnt or hard.   My bf ordered a BYOB, that he demolished & the bleu buffalo fries. Omg. Those fries! I'm a sucker for buffalo sauce and these fries were coated in it with a generous amount of bleu cheese crumbles on top. The best part, even with all the buffalo sauce the fries weren't soggy.   They also have a ton of beers on tap, huge plus! Needless to say we will be back !

RmLfab6bMEcPuFCiBIwXcQ.text: The food is exquisite!  I had the farmers daughter and the truffle fries...absolutely amazing, best burger in Charlotte.  The host is super nice and the girls at the bar were phenomenal as far as service is concerned.  The beer list is extensive and all the beers that I True were wonderful.  The atmosphere is what sets this place apart,  a place I want to return to often.

PnNLRQZltmJlfKscjPfkkQ.text: First time here. It is exactly as it states, burgers and beer. Nice decor, friendly service, casual atmosphere, food delivered within a decent timing.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey burger &amp; fries

cJU-dWkuVpntNWR4YLB4CA.text: So, I have only been here twice, but this place is a definite go-to if you're in the plaza midwood area.   The service is exceptional, and the food is great too! I got a chicken sandwich, and I really wasn't expecting it to be that great since it is a burger joint and all. But it was really good. And when we ordered the rosemary and thyme fries, we didn't like the seasoning on them at all and the server was very nice about it and offered to give us just plain fries in place for them.   The only reason I give it 4 stars is the beer prices. They are a little overpriced considering the area, I could walk right down the block and pay $3 less for the same pint of beer. But other than that, for a good bite to eat it's a great place to go!

x4nKbe-cOJ3WWuK7vEeLUg.text: Great place for burger enthusiasts and great place for Carolina fans. Wide range of burgers ( basic, bison, salmon, turkey) and build your own option. Great beer selection. Drink specials for UNC games.

8KdNPpC606pHrnQ4QN6hdQ.text: Amazing service. Great food! Love the produce burger & their sweet potato fries are the best. Pretty nice beer selection & a great outdoor patio area

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Produce burger &amp; sweet potato fries on point

taMu_IxJjC3JstdFC1MV3Q.text: Loved this place.  Really cute restaurant tucked away in Plaza Midwood.  I initially only stopped in for a beer but decided to get food.  I ordered the local love flight and it didn't disappoint.  What a great idea!  For dinner, I had the Peter Piper.  There is a little kick to it but overly spicy.  I can't wait to go back and try other burgers.  In they neighborhood they are know for the "blue" cups and are a Tarheels bar.  Their Instagram is pretty cool and fun, you should check that out too!

FAhZt4lZ34bYf-qLTK3yOg.text: Amazing beer selections? Check. GF buns? Check. Vegetarian options? Check. Build your own burger? Check.  That is just the start of the praise I want to sing for Moo & Brew. I came in with my boyfriend and sister on a Saturday evening. It was packed, both inside and outside on the (cute) patio. Unfortunately the seating is fairly limited due to M&B working with a small space. The hostess took our number and told us it would be around half an hour before seating became available. During our wait, not even five minutes in, a gentleman came outside to us and asked if we minded being in close quarters with one another. We laughed and said we are family so no, we don't mind. He said they had a little corner table by a window and it shares a bench with another table. He asked one of us to come with him to see it before we said yes, just so he could ensure we would be comfortable. The table was perfect for us and we definitely recognize his goal was to please us and all of his customers, he was such a cool and pleasant guy.   Once seated we selected our beers and had the M&B cold platter (black bean hummus, pimento cheese, carrots, cucumbers, flatbread) to start. It was the perfect size for the three of us to share and was delicious. After devouring that in an instant, we went on to select our burgers. My sister was able to swap the beef burger for a black bean burger on the "brew raised shroom and swiss", which was awesome that they accommodate for people's desires and/or needs. My boyfriend had the salmon burger and did not talk almost the entire time because he was focused on his enjoyment of the flavor, and I had the Fresh Produce burger. I cannot say how much I L.O.V.E. when I consume a black bean burger that is FRESH and does NOT taste like they went to Costco and bought bulk frozen patties. It had great flavor and spice and the toppings were so delicious (I mean come on... avocado, pepper jack, fresh herb aioli.... heavenly). I was the only one to get the sweet potato fries at the table and I can tell you right now: the best I have ever had. I could have eaten 4x the amount and not even felt guilty about it. Just the perfect sweetness/crunch and dipped into the honey mustard sauce you get with them you'll never want to order another type of fry again. It will be a struggle for me to veer away and try to "up my fry game" next time with one of their many other options.   We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The only negative to the night was when the waitress had a mood swing and ended up getting extremely agitated and irritable for about 3/4 of our time there. I did not dock the review for this, trying to be understanding that it was a busy Saturday night and I am sure she had been through it. Hopefully this will not be experienced again. My boyfriend and I will be back and we urge everyone to support this business!

jtxvi1kOEpy_pTc1FTb9YQ.text: Great burgers and beer selection.  The pickled fried green tomatoes were excellent!! And turkey burger was delicious and juicy.

423DH-Dcb9ZHtEzaljA59g.text: Not that impressed!   The service was good & so we're the cheese curds but I didnt care for the black bean burger or the dyno-mite fries.   It was also really loud inside so it was impossible to hear anything.   So, after struggling to find a parking spot, waiting in the cold for a table, shouting out my order over the noise and eating so-so food, I decided I won't be coming back.

oB7dBb_DJqSHp0d04ei61Q.text: Great beer list and very interesting burger selection. Bison is great as well as the other burgers. Great service also.

yFnAxWLPF2HmJF9ovikJTg.text: I tried this place on a Saturday night and it was packed.  I got a seat at the bar (first come) pretty quickly.  The staff was very nice and attentive.  The restaurant was sooooo hot inside that I could barely think of what I wanted and actually ordered so quickly just to get something to eat and leave.  The food came out promptly.  I had a spicy burger which was cooked medium.  The bacon wrapped around the pepper inside was a little disappointing.  It was not crispy and was in fact, pretty undercooked and soggy.  The idea of the burger was pretty good, it just didn't come out the way I had hoped.  I finished really fast and got out of there because of the heat.  It was really miserable to sit on the inside of a restaurant and feel so hot and sweaty.  Uncomfortable and it def gave me a headache.  I may try this place again-NOT recommended for summertime. PS: I don't even remember the beer list or selection because I was too hot.

DYgm_w4GjItGnCvc29LYJg.text: I've passed by this place so many times and I've seen a few pics go almost viral on Instagram. I never could find the time but I heard that food network was filming so I decided to make that the reason I finally go lol. I got there around 11 am abs there was no immediate parking . I'll blame they on the fact that filming was going on. I ended up parking about a block way. When I got inside there was no wait. I opted to sit outside which was a bad idea only because it was a bit windy that day and I get cold very easily! Next time I'll stay inside. I ordered the moo and brew burger I believe it was called and sweet potato fries. The burger came with chili and cheese and I wanted it well done. The sweet potato fries were a nice addition. Since it was 11am I ordered a ginger ale to drink! Even though they were filming the wait for the food was not long at all! My waiter was extremely attentive and I left full and happy. They do have a signature drink there that I will try the next time I go. It's very instagramable (maybe that's not s word lol) Anyway this place is definitely a must try if you are in the Charlotte area and I'm sure when you see it on food network soon you will see I tell no lies lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States

ocUeQK6ztuEF0tnRUVCm-g.text: If you wanted mediocre food you could have gone to Denny's.   Today's special: Unfried green tomatoes.

AQUtkCWqjri07nZRnRcYCg.text: Who cares about another burger place, right? UM, WRONG!  I was so pleasantly surprised by this place!  I would even go as far to say, watch out Bang Bang!  We decided to eat here the other night, and I was so glad we did! We started with some beers. They have a great local selection, but also have other beers you don't find as much that were good to try.   I ordered the Turkey burger as prompted by the waitress, and boy was she right. The turkey burger was moist (what a concept!) and perfectly cooked. I loved the peppers and goat cheese on the burger. We also ordered the rosemary, truffle fries and the sweet potato fries. Both of the fries were exceptional! Really some of the better fries I have had. Perfectly crisp and not too greasy.   Overall, it was the perfect spot for the evening. We went on a Friday evening before Christmas, so it wasn't very packed at all. It seems to have a nice patio and we were able to find a parking spot in the lot right away. Our waitress was very kind and enjoyable and service was fast. This may be our new spot over Bang Bang....

ba9VpwKlw73IRqg7krIa2Q.text: Loved the food and atmosphere.  It was a relaxing environment.  I was able to sit outside and relax.   Whenever anything was needed I went to the side window to order.  So convenient.  The staff remembered our orders and was quick with recommendations and refills.

Fg5kit2sh6xMDeUJZopZiQ.text: I like this place a lot and I'm not sure it is because the staff were amazing or the location. Stopped in for a quick burger and beer with a friend who was helping me move into the area on Sunday. +1 for having a parking lot and luckily available parking when I pulled in!   Sometimes staff in 'hip' restaurants can be a bit pretentious, but not at Moo and Brew the staff were amazing from start to end. The guys at the door were funny and made us feel super comfortable, almost like we were regulars! The waitress was attentive and even remembered the exact type of beer I had when she asked if I wanted a second round! I know that might be of minimal importance to some, but after a few lackluster service experience this week in Charlotte, it was greatly appreciated.  Prices were reasonable, especially if you build your own burger the base price is $6 and goes up based on topping choices. Definitely know where to go when my budget gets a little tight!   Oh and try the Good Morning Vietnam from Wooden Robot, great beer!

5avKoFPJK9fhFg1Qh3hUrw.text: More Brew, less Moo.  I was so excited about this local burger place, but it came up a few dollars short. The location is primo and the few times we've been there the brews have been flowing.   The Brew: The beer selection is from the best of the best local and they are constantly changing their taps. Moo & Brew has a featured brewery of the month, too.   The Moo: This is where it came up short. I know a good burger when I see one, and each burger I've ordered hasn't knocked my socks off. I was really hankering a veggie burger and after confirming with the staff the black bean burgers are frozen (not made in-house/fresh) which is ironic considering the name of the burger: Fresh Produce, I opted for the Rocket Turkey. Now, I cannot confirm that the turkey burger is made in-house/fresh, but the accompaniments: goat cheese, arugula, fig spread and roasted red pepper sounded like it would pair beautifully. Again, it was a 7.5/10 it didn't blow me away but was decent. I felt the same with I ordered the Way out West Bison BUrger and swapped the bison patty for the Salmon patty. The accompaniments sound delightful and I am starting to salivate while writing this, but again the burger was just coming up short.   Everything else: The fries is why I will come back. It doesn't matter if you upgrade that order or just go with the classic, these fries are what will hook you. Fire green tomatoes, a Southern staple, and Moo & Brew is making them right.  The staff is friendly and they have an awesome patio out front and a great spot for yard games. This is a great spot if you have pets.

IZAx1_YvhrMEAbcjYP4QsQ.text: I've been to Moo & Brew about five times now so I think I'm more than due for a review. Let's start off with the scene: they have a nice outdoor set-up with some communal tables, some bar-height seating, and some individual tables. You can order drinks at the walk-up window, which is fun. They have a big awning that they set up in the summer so you don't suffer in the scorching sun.  Inside is usually a bit loud. There are a number of TVs, a bar, and many tables of varying heights. Some fun memorabilia. It's a definitively FUN, relaxed atmosphere.  I love their waitstaff. The women in particular are so friendly and welcoming. Anyone will be happy to talk you their vast beer selection. And man, do they have a GREAT variety of beers. I'm not much of a beer gal but I know enough to recognize how awesome their spread is. They also have some wine (not great) and some cocktails. They are infamous for their outlandish bloody mary. If you want your bloody to come with food on top, Moo & Brew is the place.  Finally, onto the food. The pickins' as moderately slim for a vegetarian. Their cold platter is delicious. Those lavash crackers - YUM. I've only ever gotten the fire cobb salad, sometimes with a veggie burger on top. ALWAYS get it with the adobo ranch. I love that dressing so much. It's definitely not a healthy salad, but boy is it yummy.  The veggie burger, which can be customized into whatever you want, is good. I've grown a bit weary of the black bean style, but I do appreciate that theirs is homemade. I recommend ordering it as is on the menu, but the customization options are endless. Their fries are great. The sweet potato fries are a solid 7.5/10. The parmesan fries, however, blew my mind. They are completely addictive. Love those fries.  Overall, it's a solid neighborhood joint. I will always admire Moo & Brew for its strong spirit and happy waitstaff. They also regularly host events which seem very well-received. So I'm sure I will soon be back!

jEE0njuwqgRQteZm6AQVYQ.text: Definitely my new favorite burger and brew joint. The selection and quality is unbeatable. The staff is so friendly and welcoming. This place is definitely a gem of Charlotte. Hope they expand to Raleigh soon!!!

8ZqVKE0yikHGP-Bxn59RPA.text: Been meaning to stop by this place for awhile now. There are so much good things to rave about.  Drinks - they had a huge selection of beers, including a ton from local breweries. I went with the Raspberry Wit from Sugar Creek (which was awesome) and my boyfriend had the Peach Cider from Windy Hill (he loved it). We got a good amount for the price, too, which is always a win.   Apps- we went with the cheese curds. I only had a few because I can't do a lot of dairy (and this meal was HEAVY on dairy) but they were soooooo good! I would definitely get these again and again and again and again. My boyfriend wants to try to the pork rinds next time but I ain't eating that, so he's on his own there.  Burgers- my boyfriend had the farmers daughter burger and loved it. I had a build you own black bean burger. I'll be honest, it was just okay. Here's the thing, I'm not a crazy meat lover. I will eat a good steak but for the most part, don't want to eat a lot of meat. The black bean burger was great on flavor but fell apart when I would try to pick it up and eat it. I ended up just eating with a fork. Both burgers came on a Martin's Potato Roll, which... I mean...who doesn't love those!?!?!  Fries- we made the mistake of ordering two separate fries to share. We got the nacho fries (my boyfriend loved them, they were a bit much for me) and the rosemary garlic fries (we both loved). However, this was a ton of food! We did not even eat 1/4 of either of them. Tip: just share fries with your boo there.   Service- our server, Matt, was great. He was friendly, welcoming, helpful and made our experience super enjoyable.   Price- I feel like this place was somewhat overpriced. We spent over $50, which is a bit more than I think it was worth.   All in all, for a splurge burger spot - this place is solid. We will definitely be back.

Z-PVFpWLBvMcASuUUFZ8Pg.text: This was good. Great patio. Good food. Get the truffle fries. I like that they have a skinny option! Great burgers. Great beer list. Cool little burger joint. Parking stinks though!

vICQzWgUYNFXU_Rude_8bw.text: It is what it sets out to be... A solid spot for burgers and fries!   We started with the cheese curds, which were a greasy delight on our cheat day (aka Faturday). The highlight for me was the sweet potato fries. We shared a BYOB burger with smoked provolone, avocado, bacon, pickled red onions, tomato and spicy mayo. It was a delicious, gooey, mess! Annnnnd, more fries of the rosemary truffle variety, these with garlic aioli.   Their beer selection was fantastic and I appreciate they offer flights. I hate having to choose between so many tasty sounding beers.   They have an awesome patio that I imagine will be full as soon as Summer's heat and humidity are gone.

5570CqhIGLQQFTNgtljB7w.text: Cool Atmosphere! We decided to stop here while visiting Charlotte. They are known for their burgers and their bloody Mary's.   I decided to get a Cobb Salad, which was very tasty. The only downfall would be the size of the actual salad was very small. I also ordered a side of sweet potato fries. They were delicious and perfectly cooked.   I would stop back, just would get something else.

2eqCz_pmQ4fEUid0Q-Jsgw.text: Have been here to many times to count and have always loved the food and atmosphere. However, Sad to say I won't ever be going back after I was refused entry this weekend because of having my licensed, highly trained service dog with me. I hope in the future this place welcomes people with disabilities and the animals who serve them better.

7unt-rP2bKNM27nppP-sIw.text: Great atmosphere we are hanging out watching the Georgia game and the two women bartenders are awesome!  Great food great times

Ha8FNwtFAzEbNKvr0-FKTA.text: Thoroughly impressed would be the words I'd use to describe brew and moo. By far this was the best burger I have had in charlotte with good service too!   We originally had a party of 4 but that changed to 5 at the last second and they were more than willing to accommodate us. The waiter was nice and checked in on us enough. I would give the service 4-stars by itself.   I had the "farmers daughter" burger with fries and it was top notch. The burger was cooked great with a delicious egg, bacon and perfect bun. The fries were crispy and their BBQ sauce was great too.   They play great music and the atmosphere is good too. It is quite loud so don't expect a quiet meal! I will be back soon!

7lngm8QZNba8tAW1aS2afg.text: A friend and I ate at moo & brew last night. Today, we both have food poisoning. I called and spoke to a manager this morning. I told him what happened and he asked "did you go to the doctor?" I replied that I don't have health insurance & had to call out of work today. He said "hope you feel better". That was it. He wasn't concerned, he didn't really apologize. I didn't sleep last night, spending hours in the bathroom because of your food and you can't even apologize? Damn.

3wmC6qJSNmfp9-Vo8qvcHQ.text: I stopped by Moo & Brew on a Wednesday evening for dinner and a few beers - it was delightful!  The venue looks great - plenty of seats at the bar, mix of low top and high top tables and a large patio out front.  It also looks like they are prepping the side for additional outdoor seating and walk-up bar.  The parking lot is small - this may be an issue on busy nights, but was not a problem while we were there.  We sat at the bar to get a first hand look at the 40ish taps.  Wow, what a great selection of beer!  There were several options that I haven't seen anywhere else - this alone makes this an awesome addition to the n'hood.  On Tuesday nights, you can get $5 blue cups (from He's Not Here in Chapel Hill - 32 oz.) of PBR.  Typically I don't drink PBR - but, put it in a $5 blue cup and I may change my mind.  If not, for a $3 upcharge, you can have OMB Copper, Lagunitas IPA or Sweetwater 420.  The also have a Midwood Mule on tap with Tito's vodka - it's heavy on the ginger, giving it a nice spicy finish.  For food, you have a selection of gourmet burgers and salads - or you can build your own starting with the bread type (including a gluten-free option), cheese, meat, toppings and sauces.  I opted for a salmon burger with lettuce, tomato, onion, bacon, avocado and herb aioli - YUM, YUM, YUM!  My partner went with the bison burger - very, very tasty.  For my side, I ordered the sweet potato fries.  OMG - Sweet. Potato. Fries.  I'm not obsessive over much, but these fries were incredible.  Seriously, incredible.  Thick slices of potato that were perfectly crispy on the outside.  These fries were enough for me to keep coming back.  The bartenders were attentive and friendly.  I'm thrilled to have this option in Plaza Midwood.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States

7ACRW3Xk6sI-x1WwMeBayQ.text: We went to their beer fest and we were looking forward to their restaurant opening. Surprise bout how small the restaurant was.  The outside eating area equals the inside.  Let's move on...  Quickly ordered two of their extensive craft beers on tap. Looking around, noticed they have one long both with five single tables to be able to sit two; one booth, one chair per table.  They have have bistro seating with 9 bar stools, a plus.  We ordered a build your own burger and sweet potato fries. Fries - DELICIOUS and definitely get the M&B sauce, winner! Apparently the skinny bun equates to a mini roll bun so the meat exceeds bout an inch.  Sounds great, low carbs, right? Until you contemplate how to eat it.  No worries because it was fantastic, fresh and juicy.   Don't mind workers eating at the establishment; however, do not eat amongst patrons wearing the "uniform".  Simply, it's in poor taste.    Overall, this place rocks! Delicious food, great service. Oh and the music is great too.

5oY2FWxHx1oVZid7iVKdDA.text: Yum yum Yummers! My husband and I will definitely be visiting again soon. It's a really cute craftsman style restaurant off Central.   Cheese curds- warm, gooey, fried cheese, that is as delectable as it sounds. The sauce is a type of cheese marinara and it is wonderful.  Not your farmers daughter burger- with a fried egg and peppered bacon and cheddar cheese you cannot go wrong. I'm not sure what is in their housemate m+b sauce but it compliments the burger nicely.  Build your own burger- lots of good options and fresh ingredients Fries- really yummy and fresh  Buffalo and blue cheese fries- my new favorite dish. I could come here and just eat these all day long. I highly recommend adding these to your meal.  Beer- definitely recommend the flight. They had some great fruity options. I would highly recommend the watermelon beer.   The service could be better but it wasn't horrible.bit wouldn't stop us from coming again. Just a tip not to bring big groups here as it is a pretty small space. However, there is a nice patio deck with seating.

4vPCN39RxpJzsBtMehpTmg.text: Stopped here tonight while in the area. Called ahead and the sweet hostess held us a table. We were seated immediately upon arrival. I'm usually not a fan of high tops but it wasn't terribly uncomfortable. Service was very quick and our server was courteous. They ran out of the beer my boyfriend wanted, but as the beer menu was extensive he quickly found a replacement. The only thing I didn't particularly like was how loud it was! Could barely hear each other. The food however was very yummy! I've never had cheese curds but they were DELICIOUS. We will definitely be back.

fnAEF5qbT8Qqke1rWa1eKg.text: Atmosphere was good setting was fairly decent. In my opinion the prices was over priced. I would highly recommend a different burger chain, personally Bad Daddy's is great to me. The nacho fries messed up my stomach I think the chili and cheese on the fries was very very unsettling. Highly don't recommend it. The burger itself was okay.

dWSXdMO6jQJ6f5T0YfKkXQ.text: Walk in through sliding glass door into what 80s bars should have been. Blondie on radio. Great draft seletion.  Great, friendly staff. Burgers are really good. Really good. Cheese curds are a must. Lost of one star. Limp fries. If fries crispy, easy 5.

0yyhWu9_sGlxSYRPpN7jRA.text: The burger was superb and the buffalo bleu fries were phenomenal. Great place for a Moo and Brew

w_ZtSHyIyuHgrS5afvbavw.text: From So Cal and this was a cool little spot. Great beers on tap and burgers were excellent!

vc_KqSyn-87t6IySWwblJQ.text: I've heard a lot of good things about moo and brew, so decided to try it out. I feel their burger was just average. Fries were burnt and cold. Got great service though. And enjoyed the decor. Not good enough to go back for my liking.

TySV75m3STOrSRJ8oHTiww.text: Seriously one of the best burgers I have ever had! I had the Peter piper (not sure if that was the exact name) and it was amazing! We ate inside, but the patio looked like a great place to sit too! Very family friendly! Saw lots of babies sitting and enjoying their time there as well. I can't wait to get back and try some more off the awesome menu!

4-Llvjaa9Tls0ZdL7tI_HQ.text: Have been twice and both times the burgers have been delicious. Great selection of toppings/ways to customize. Good atmosphere, friendly people, reasonable prices. They also do take out although that's not their main business.

ubPGodWwLPlOFmaN8LpnwA.text: Poor service, but above above burgers. The server was not well versed on the menu. I'm not completely counting this against them because they are a new restaurant.

GD-Z7H66_B_9FIyN-_wTnQ.text: I finally tried this place out last week. It was absolutely  amazing!! The best burger I have had in a very long time!! I got the Farmers Daughter and bleu buffalo fries DELICIOUS!! You can't go wrong with this spot. I am sure everything is fantastic. We seriously loved it and very cool atmosphere..check this place out!

JBHnHREzouQgtxXB0aqWwQ.text: Excellent service, great atmosphere and food ok. Unfortunately all 7 of our burgers were extremely well done/overcooked. As good as our waitress was she never came back to check as she had another large party. First time there excellent but if we have the same experience next time we won't be back.

fykAQtgfnSa1wHPMPQHtQA.text: Clearly one of the best burger hangouts in town. Beer selection is ahmazing!  Peter piper burger, cheese curds, firecrackers, and loaded nacho fries. Fantastic!!  Go and enjoy but don't tell too many people.

ejk9quxXE-DPIycjKuqt0Q.text: Ken,Zach and the gang have "hit a home run" with this place! Food is excellent (beef, chicken, salmon are fresh/clean/organic tasting.) Atmosphere is really good, patio is perfect! But....the best part of this place is the staff! Bartenders are attentive, engaging and fun! And every single manager sincerely engages customers, they all sit and talk/visit/check on you! Best place in my Plaza Midwood"hood!"

4KLPmtYoer79owYuQmSa3w.text: The service was great but the kitchen is where things went horribly wrong. I ordered the Turkey burger. I'm pregnant and can't have non fully cooked meat, so I thought this was a safe choice. I was horribly wrong. The turkey was completely raw inside. When we mentioned it to our server she immediately went to the kitchen and came back saying that they told her it's supposed to be pink because of the seasoning they add to the turkey. After we insisted it was raw, she went back with the sandwich this time, and came back to us saying yes, it was raw, and they would cook a new one. The new sandwich came and was deep fried in order to ensure that it was fully cooked. I did not want to eat a deep fried sandwich, nor should a turkey burger be deep fried. My husband told the general manager about this, no apology was given at all, only excuses that they add a red wine seasoning to the turkey thus the color, but did say they've had complaints all day about the same issue. I'll never go here again as this place is highly overrated.

vhic_YC2yvdE1zXHcBwZfQ.text: Great burgers! Super nice host at the door as well as the runners who brought most of our food. The server? Not so much. Don't know his name bc he never told us. Red hair. His partner, Asian girl with no bra (not that she needed one) lol. Thumbs down for their service skills!

0gdw_VVbG_znhwdO5_LkVQ.text: Great service, service alone could make it a 3.5. But my build your own burger was greasy. The fries were decent. Will try again in a few months.

dxhi_HFpDX_tB1c9TqGD7w.text: Nice atmosphere and many local brews to choose from.  The fries were awesome, the only thing not perfect was the bison burger I ordered was over cooked and a little dry.  Would definitely recommend this place.

f_0JvxpIv7sXn_307HktFQ.text: Burger was ok - fries were really soggy - drinks watered down. Shame since this is a great location.

pdcqnZX0Me4sYNVccvpwaA.text: You would think that a place who uses "brew" in the name of the restaurant, you could actually get some beers there without having to practically beg the incompetent waitstaff to bring you another one when your glass has been sitting empty for 15-20 minutes.  It wouldn't have been so bad if the food was really good, but I'd honestly rather eat a burger from five guys.  The fries were cold and soggy when brought out, and my burger was also cold when it came to the table, the table that had nothing to drink on it.  Maybe our the servers were taking smoke breaks or doing drugs or something, but they certainly weren't taking care of their customers.  The only thing decent about the place was the cheese fritters, which were ok, but nothing to write home about.  Last but not least, the "dog-friendly" patio was pretty annoying when people kept bringing their disobedient dogs who were constantly barking.  The dogs would have been a bit more tolerable if I was able to get some drinks.  I was there for an hour and a half and got 3 beers, two of which I had to flag or waitress down for because she wasn't paying attention.

bSL3wV-EZkHykeHChMNoHQ.text: This place has been consistently awesome in the short time it has been open. Amongst the best craft brews on tap in Charlotte.

jPwkUvjct97gX7DITgxr1A.text: Moo & Brew is a spot that will entice you from the menu and beer selection but I am so happy to say that the service is equally as high quality as the food and beer. To start, I was with a larger party so we had to grab a beer at the bar and wait. When we checked in with the host, Bryant, he was honest about the wait time and recommended we grab a drink. The bartenders were attentive, knowledgeable and extremely accommodating. Bryant went above and beyond to keep our party in the loop on the progress of our wait and making sure we were happy. We waited about 20 minutes as promised, and upon being seated at our table, Jesse, our server, picked up right where the bartenders and Bryant left off. He was prompt with waters for the table and all of our specific needs for our orders came out flawless. The overall atmosphere at Moo & Brew is cool with a great local vibe and interesting decor. I would strongly recommend this spot, KUDOS to great service!!! We will be back!

ybzIBlL0QdErXESS3sa9nQ.text: Great burger & the sweat Potatoe fries with the specialty mustard on the side was great too. Nice selection of beer in a good atmosphere.  I will be back -often

bGvr4rALY7kNzNv1ZJAyeA.text: The food and service here were excellent!  Our server was great at making recommendations and very friendly.  I got the Rocket Turkey and Sweet Potato fries and my husband built his own burger and had black beans.  We both really enjoyed our meals.  I can't wait to go back and try another burger.  I also can't wait to go on a night when I want to drink as they had some fun flight combinations of beers, as well as a build your own option!

LIrOR6bhCjsqLFHrIx5Vug.text: I was so excited to try this place on the reviews alone.  However this was a disappointing 1st visit. The restaurant was very busy which is always a good sign. So we sat out side. The waitress acknowledge us immediately and quickly got us our drink order and we ordered the fried pickles which were very good. However the cokes where very flat so disappointing. I ordered a buger built by me and ordered it medium well with a hot pink center. When my Burger came it was way over cooked and the truffle fries weren't hot. However, due to a thunder storm coming quickly I was unable to complain. If you are parking on the other side of central have you will have to pay 3.00 but if you send 20.00 or more it is taken off your ticket. Please remember to take a picture of your recipient tho. Overall the food wasn't bad but it was average. However, I'm going to give it one more try maybe I'll have better luck the next time. Our waitress made up for the experience.

VXAiS3JgJz1mGO706nACjA.text: Had the Bison Burger... A maze ing! Great flavor and even proportion of toppings and the goat cheese made it ! Fries were awesome and the hosts were friendly and attentive to everyone. Wait wasnt bad and the midtown mule made the wait even better. First timer! Will return!!

SoRgx8ByIrKx44ytf2pm0g.text: WOW!  We were looking for something 'fun' and new (that we could sit outside and eat) on a recent sunny Saturday afternoon and stumbled upon Moo & Brew from other yelp reviews.  I was pleasantly surprised how good the food and service was and we thoroughly enjoyed our time and meal!  I had the turkey burger that was beyond YUMMY and my husband and son had the make your own burgers.  We all loved our choices and will definitely be back again soon.  Making this even more enjoyable was the large outside deck and there was a bank playing next door in the parking lot for an added perk on this sunny warm October Saturday making the day even more perfect!

XxZt8QR3HpWgMv0CYbBU3A.text: My husband and I joined a group of friends here for brunch and we're really excited to try this place for the first time. He orders a Bloody Mary which seemed rather popular and I ordered a mojito.  The mojito was way too sweet, weak and the mint wasn't muddled. We both ordered burgers, not much else to choose from.  He ordered medium and got very well done.  I ordered the mushroom and Swiss- had a total of 2 mushrooms and my Swiss wasn't even melted.  The fries were pretty good though.  Overall, disappointed and don't plan on coming back.

FxUWAKCfPSEPc0OpXVULTA.text: What a great addition to Plaza Midwood!  Unique and delicious burger choices. Plenty of awesome local beers on tap. Cool outside area with walk up beer and cocktail window.  The Rocket turkey burger with goat cheese and  balsamic fig spread was incredible. They did not skimp on the toppings. Rosemary truffle fries were addicting. Taos beans were hearty, spicy and a delicious healthy side. Service was spot on. Great staff, friendly bartenders, and a cool vibe. A welcome addition to Plaza Midwood. Keep up the good work!

zfewhZNIBiqO6_BJha1qEQ.text: Moo and Brew delivers an excellent burger stop without going over board. The beer and drink selection is great as well. I loved that there were different fry options. I can't wait to return!

1I7qfyuXJF0QqP10sf1T7w.text: Wow, what a great place. Beer selection, extensive, eclectic and unique. Burgers are over the top and the loaded fries are a meal by themselves. Very cool vibe, service was much better than you would expect in a crowded burger place. And what do you know, cloth napkins....someone's mother must be involved! Really a great new go to place.

lq10jAMuaY0pqYl42dYiqg.text: GREAT FOOD WITH A GREAT STAFF! The special fries are worth splurging on, and make sure to try the sauces that come with them. I was impressed with their selection of beer on draft! 10/10 would recommend. But be sure to check on the wait times before you go

D-9bPkBWK8ZGTDBZcHUTxg.text: Margarita was good but it was the worst black bean burger I've ever had. Don't waste your time here. Big Daddy's is WAY better.

Lxio85_YVFBSTT4saT1OOQ.text: Great beer selection, great hostess, tried to get us a table even when the patio closed due to rain, ended up sitting at the bar. The bartenders weren't very friendly, ignored us a lot, we ended up just giving up on trying to get more than a beer or two each, and just waited for the food. The spicy fries and the truffle fries were both just waaaaay over seasoned, the truffle drenched in truffle oil, the spicy with waay to much ghost pepper spice. The burgers are nothing to write home about, very bland no seasoning on the meat. I don't know if that's the norm, or if it was because the kitchen was backed up. While waiting for a table/our order I counted at least 6 people that sent their food back. The overall great reviews make me think I came on an off night, so I'll give it another chance and update

xsffQPRVwf9XHAQtrP4hIw.text: Another generic burger spot. Bland, tasteless, burgers and soggy fries. Places like this need to stop opening.

N1YSwXEMBbwJwDm3sUjaaA.text: Do not pass up the opportunity to try this place. We received the most amazing customer service on a busy Friday night that we've experienced in a very long time. I ordered the Shroom and Swiss burger with sweet potato fries. The mustard sauce with the fries was very good although it looked like peanut butter and threw me of a little at first. The burger was juicy, seasoned, and cooked perfectly. It was piled high with mushrooms that tasted like they had been cooked in a delicious wine sauce or something and topped with yummy Swiss cheese. I will support this place every single time I'm in the area! Thank you Moo & Brew!!!

YYLswP7sMphdtdTeZ7Y-Lg.text: My husband and I just got back from eating dinner at Moo & Brew. This place is awesome! Great beer menu & they even offer beer flights. We had the Farmers Daughter & Peter Piper with sweet potato fries and buffalo fries. Everything was delicious and cooked to perfection. This is a must place to check out if you live around the Plaza Midwood area.

skdEKP4_SDPXYF7GCkZLww.text: The food was very dry and drinks were less to be desired. I know they are known for beer.....but so is everyone else in Charlotte and we just wanted some qualities drinks....this was not the place to go....and not the place to go for a good burger as well. I ordered the salmon Burger and took the salmon and put it in my side salad and enjoyed it better than the dry freezer burnt tasting bun.

WSdeL7kmMkpfcKq44DLTng.text: Delicious burgers. Amazing beer selection. Only problem was that it was too packed! Had to wait about 20 minutes at around 1:00pm on a Sunday. Strongly recommend for burger and beer lovers.

WfIdtJMMI5bkglkgEHF1KA.text: Burger was just ok.... nothing special at all....fries were good.....overall I probably won't go back....there are better burger places than this.

l6zke7Z5CrirbjzslQ21Ng.text: Tasty burgers, terrible service.  We enjoyed the burgers, but had a hard time getting drink refills.  Also, the fries were sort of disgusting. We got the rosemary truffle fries- no truffle taste to speak of & burnt rosemary all over them- yuck.  Stick to the burgers, & maybe sit at the bar.

ve7WcvrGVYiQ_mcEuW4BRA.text: Stopped by on a Saturday afternoon with a group of 5. There was a wait, so we headed to the bar for a drink. They have a great local draft list and plenty of seating. After about 20 minutes we were seated. We started off with the pork rinds and cheese curds. The pork rinds were great and spicy! They come in a larger portion, so there was plenty for 5 of us to share. The cheese curds were gooey good and so was the sun-dried tomato ranch they came with.   I got the Rocket Turkey burger. Yes, I got a turkey burger at a burger restaurant but I don't eat a lot of beef and I've been wanting to try this place since I've had it booked marked for months now. Soooo, get the rocket turkey! It's sooo juicy! I loved everything about it; goat cheese, fig spread and roasted red pepper on a potato bun. I would get it again in a heart beat! I also got it with the buffalo fries and a much needed side of ranch. Fries are hand-cut and yummy!  Our server, Evan was great like super great! She was constantly refilling our water, checking on us and did it all with a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo fries with the Rocket turkey burger

RDYDK_TGHqH80ItoKf6bYQ.text: Really pleased!!! A nice surprise.   I love there outside seating!! Will definitely go back!  Lunch: Salmon Patty- my friend said, good! You could really taste the salmon, not a lot of filler.  Salad- lettuce, onion straws, cheese curds, cheddar cheese, carrots- yummy  Sides: Cheese curds- incredible!! A better name would be cheese bites. It's like a cheese stick with beer batter.  French Fries- greasy & soft.  Another time, my friend really liked them!   Sweet potato fries- Amazing, some of the best I've ever had.

Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese curds- incredible!!    French Fries-  greasy &amp; soft, wouldn&#39;t recommend!!

vHI2Xpky7SiY-mu_ATt-Fw.text: I was very eager to try this place due to the fact that it received high praise from people whose foodie opinions I trust. I love a good burger and always look forward to trying a new burger spot. We showed up on a Friday evening, around 6:00ish and was able to park ourselves right at the bar. M&B is a small spot, located not too far behind the shopping center that houses Bistro la bon and Family Dollar. There is very limited parking (we uber'd) but they do have a nice patio out front with an up close view of the nearby construction - #cranecity.  M&B has a very extensive beer list (lots of local drafts) as well as cocktails and wine options. I went with the Tropicmose (I may not have spelled that correctly) - very, very good - and ordered the jive turkey burger with rosemary, truffle fries. All listed burgers come with choice of fries, a choice of rosemary/truffle/sea salt, parmesan/garlic/olive oil, or chili loves cheese fries.  My burger was delicious and one that I absolutely would order again. My dining compatriot ordered a craft-your-own burger (rather, chicken sandwich) and got the parmesan fries. I was a HUGE fan of the parmesan and ended up eating more of those than the ones I ordered.  The various bartenders that night were very friendly and willingly offered up their own recommendations. They also made sure that we were satisfied with our meals and checked in on our need for refills.  This is a fun spot with good food and I hear it gets especially festive when there's a big game on.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rosemary &amp; truffle fries on the left and Parmesan fries on the right
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jive turkey burger

kdF-NiSAckyTk4drcVdf3w.text: Food was phenomenal!! Great atmosphere, great food, service was great! War Warrior beer was good! Best chili cheese fries I've ever eaten. Can't say enough good about this place!

9XzP0SXFyHCO2qmyBNui_g.text: Great hamburgers and a great selection of beer.   The one star reduction is for the people smoking outside and the bartender that keeps opening and closing the window letting in smoke.   The fries are very very good.

LF9SBwoIrsPhB1gVP67ENA.text: My favorite burger place in Charlotte. The Jalapeno popper burger is the best in town. I really believe the Charlotte agenda and other places that rate this as 5 or 6th beat in Charlotte is wrong. I have tried the others and this is still ahead. Parking isn't the best but still worth a visit. Drink prices are average as well.

1Hk3RAaWBUFluIRyICYf-Q.text: Come here if you're looking for good burgers, a spin on fried pickles, and the most amazing Bloody Mary in Charlotte.   Fried pickle lovers, prepare to have your mind blown. Their twist on the classic is ADDICTIVE: pickled fried green tomatoes. These green tomatoes are the size of pickles but sooooo much better! Their batter recipe and special dipping sauce really make the appetizer what it is. You can't come here without getting them, it just wouldn't be right!  I really enjoy their Farmers Daughter burger, which has a over easy egg on top. But seriously, all their burgers are great. I recommend getting yours medium so it's not overcooked.   When it comes to brunch, the Large Marge is all you need. Served on Saturdays and Sundays this Bloody Mary will have you gawking. A full meal in itself, this 20 oz Bloody is filled with two generous shots of Titos vodka, and topped with an angus beef patty in between two grilled cheeses, a carrot, a celery stick, cheese curds, olives, a jalapeno popper, bacon, and fried green tomato. Not to mention it comes with a Miller High Life. This $18 Bloody is worth it because you get all that plus you get to take the glass home to prove you conquered the monster!   This place has limited space so they're very busy quite a lot. There's shaded patio space, which is really nice, booths inside, and high tops in the bar area. (PSA, this is Chapel Hills alumni bar.)

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pickled fried green tomatoes. These are better than any fried pickles you&#39;ll ever have!
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Large Marge. $18 and soooo worth it!

diReff1vkLiKQTE5Gcvjbg.text: Nice place, neighbor Hood feel knowledgeable bartender and good food have to have garlic parmesan fries!!! Brew advise is a bit sketchy or it could have been a bad joke

XYAHVj5jgNvdcZD84HfO8w.text: This place is pretty good, but awfully greasy - Great for a hangover cure!   The food portions are quite large & the garlic fries are so worth the upgrade :)

yEXCntBYCwrurCjn3VcxGQ.text: After I perused the extensive craft beer menu, I was able to curate an absolutely delicious flight. The list is already sorted by the heaviness of the beer, so you don't have to fumble around to figure it out. And the burger? I had the jalapeno situation and it was DELICIOUS. Count me in for a return trip in the very near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States

sBkgNh8T7cLLru2Vr5lWkA.text: Moo and Brew! What a very catchy name! So catchy that my wife and I actually turned around to give it a shot. We were thinking... they must have good burgers and good beer! Right?  THE WAIT: It took the greeter about .9 seconds to greet us when we entered. It was kindy freaky because he appeared out of the blue like the butler on the Adam Sandler movie "Mr. Deeds". But it was very much appreciated seeing that it was my wife's birthday!  THE MENU: There is a decent amount of Burgers and a ton Beers to choose from at Moo and Brew. They stick to their name 100%. There was also a bar so I'm sure a mixed drink could be ordered as well. But with a name like that, I wanted to pair my burger with a succulent beer.  MY CHOICE: I chose the Moo and Brew burger (ordered it medium) with the a special order of Parmesan, garlic, and olive oil fries. They had me at chili and onions with mustard. Also, it had the name of the bar so I was thinking a win win! Our server also said it was a great choice and very popular. My wife chose the Peter Piper (ordered it medium) due to her desire for all things spicy with regular fries.  THE VERDICT: My burger was cooked perfectly and balanced with the best seasonal beer of all time! Seriously, it was a thing of Brew heaven. The bar tender delivered it personally and said, "this is my favorite beer in the building. Enjoy" (psst the beer is called 2XMas Spiced Double Ale by Southern Tier Brewing Co). My wife's burger on the other hand lacked flavor significantly.  Especially for a burger that has jalapeno and pepper jack cheese included. The burger was also below medium cooked. It's like that cow was still moo'in and wasn't as great as the Moo and Brew burger I had.  THE SERVICE AND AMBIENCE: Our server, who I remember the name of but will not disclose, was right at par. Not great but not bad either. She waited on a table sat after us before me and my wife (which is understandable, maybe she didn't see us sitting there first although they sat right next to us) they also received their food before us (again understandable), but what she missed was my wife's Birthday. We were out for her B Day, she checked her ID, and didn't say a word. I chuckled a bit really. Overall I gave her my standard tip (still above average) when she had the chance to get my 100% tip (yes I do this because I've been in the serving industry and I know how difficult it is).  It looks really nice inside for a burger and beer joint! Nice bar, retro themed restrooms, several tv screens that had the game on display, all while being reasonably priced.  TO SUM IT UP: It's a good spot for specialty burgers and beers. ASK A LOT OF QUESTIONS. Good servers typically know what's good on the menu. I'll be giving it another try for sure.

mQcSLog9rsmVCGB5nLAVcQ.text: Possibly my favorite burger joint in Charlotte. Great bar scene and beer selection. The burgers are fantastic. The service is always great. You have to try the cheese curds, they are amazing!

o6h7nBG5wdgV5I43DDrJPA.text: Very tasty burgers and appetizers! We ordered brew cheese which were 3 pretzels with cheese on the side and firecrackle jalapenos which were deep fried stuffed jalapenos. For the entree we got the classic burger, and bison burger with loaded nacho fries, and blue buffalo fries. Everything was amazing and the service was great. Everyone was super nice and we will definitely go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burgers and amazing fries. Loaded nacho fries and bleu buffalo fries with a side salad.
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brew cheese and firecracker jalapenos! They were great and not to spicy.

hjlECReP7POpIPT_3VXvRA.text: When I am craving a DAMN good burger this is the place to go.   Correction: As a VEGETARIAN**, when I am craving a damn good burger this is the only place that will utterly satiate my needs. Believe me, I have tried many many non-meat burgers and this is my favorite in Charlotte.  Their black bean burger is the shiznit! Even if you aren't vegetarian, I would still recommend it. Obviously, I havent tried their meatier options but this place is always packed in the evenings and weekends so I think that alone speaks on its burgers.   Amazingly huge selection on craft beers, ciders (they carry ACE ciders which is quickly becoming a favorite of mine) and liquor.   I also really enjoy that they have tons of flavors for fries. First time I tried the Truffle and Sea Salt fries because I have a slight obsession with Truffle fries. They didn't necessarily disappoint but there was just waywayway too much salt for my liking. The other night I had the Parmesan Garlic fries and they were instantly my new favorite! Ugh!   Overall, I think it is really difficult to find something that you won't enjoying here.   ProTip: Use the NoWait app (you can use it via Yelp app too!) to avoid the long weekend wait!

eUsK5iuUC8FO3bC3r0ThzA.text: Went to Moo and brew for the 1st time Saturday and was expecting a wait for being on a sat afternoon. Was seated right away and given water. Our server Paige took our drink orders and was helpful with the ginormous beer selection. I got the raspberry beer and love, love love. I have got to find this beer in the grocery store!!! I ordered the classic burger and fries. Glad to see a place have a menu that doesn't take a month to read. Hopefully I will be able to go back with the hubby. Great beers and burgers, lived up to its name.

o0dF20zDQsOTDo3nL_NPcQ.text: Good burgers and crispy fries! Friendly service. Lots of patio seating. We all ordered different things and everyone enjoyed what they ate. Bonus points for having Martin's potato buns! We'll definitely return.   Side note: we decided the chest of drawers in the left bathroom are magical. Out of curiosity, we each dug around in the drawers and everybody found something different.

Oye634WejpPU5SMpN8GC-g.text: Great spot with some amazing food inspired from various parts of the country. Love the beer cheese and their Bloody Mary's are top notch!

AaBhI0XVhBsBuHB8mCEsvA.text: Reminds me of the NYC chain Bare Burger, but better. Had the bison burger which was delicious.  Cooked not too well-done, and good size. Great fries and beer & cider selection. I love the atmosphere, it has character. There are lots of tables in and outdoors, as well as good bar seating. Ideal for groups. Plus an "adult friendly" playground in the front (giant board games like Connect Four, should you have to wait.

tA5JKza1dCdflFtnKJNADA.text: The burger here was really good and recommend this place for a nice beer and burger combo.   We went in the afternoon so it wasn't too crowded and the service was good. There are television all around you unless you sit in the back . The inside is kind of small but makes the atmosphere that much more cozy.   My favorite thing here besides the burger were the sweet potato fries. Really yummy! :)   Try this place out if you want a good meal and to have a good chill time!

HVI6qLFdYJQ5JExKM2aSEw.text: This place is always pretty busy, so most people like it.   Our experience was crowded, rushed and sub par - slow service. Sure, if you're looking for an outrageous Bloody Mary that's a meal in itself, you can find it here.    I didn't think my burger was anything special. The fries were over-seasoned, unfortunately.   This seems like a good place to meet friends out at, but i'm not in a hurry to get back here.

Id1gGh3iJrPpiySXZREnVw.text: If you're looking for a quick bite this is not the place for you. If you do decide to wait to be seated, it's worth the wait. The consistency of the burgers here are always the same even though it seems like they're always busy. One of the few places that I will make the drive from huntersville into Charlotte for the food. You can either have a choice of a flight of beer or just a pint from one of the local breweries.

VQqMjGlB-mIsqwmwJCHsEg.text: Checked out this place this evening and overall we enjoyed our visit.  A couple things to note..  It is hot outside and it was hot inside. They have fans blowing and the air blasting but it was still pretty warm. Must be the large windows, the wooden interior, or some other reason but that's here nor there. The overall feel of the place is casual, sports bar.    The beer menu was more extensive than the food menu but thats ok!  I tried the turkey burger on a gluten free bun.  It had goat cheese, fig, arugula and balsamic on it.  Husband created his own burger with cheese, lettuce and tomato.  What an exotic combo! Lol.  I ordered the black beans for my side and he ordered just standard fries (you can get them as jazzed up as you want).  Here is what I will say...The burgers were just ok.  Pretty flavorless actually.  The cheese and add-ons really made it edible. Husbands tomatoes were light pink so just not yet ripened. The pickles tasted like water.  My black beans were spicy and delicious.  The fries were bland and mostly burnt ends.  I enjoyed my turkey burger but it wasnt amazing.    Service was friendly and they have an outdoor patio where you can proudly observe thirsty beaver and their patrons as they hang on for dear life!  Im so rooting for them! Way to hold your ground! I digress...  Anyway...price point normal, food average, drink menu-thorough.  Location..clutch!  You can find one reason or the other to stop by so check it out.  They have fu man chu cupcakes as their neighbor so hit them up while you are there as well.  Get the irish car bomb cupcake to stick with the brew theme of your evening.  Another thought...does pint central next door hate them? Welcome them? Love them? Deep thoughts..

EMx4rJXF4dYhmimJ6K1LSQ.text: Very good burgers! I stopped here for lunch on a Saturday around 2, and there was plenty of seating. The restaurant is dog friendly, as we had our little Yorkie, but you must sit out on the patio.   It's a really fun atmosphere, they had games outside in a AstroTurf seating area, including giant Jenga.   I got the Farmer's Daughter burger... A healthy size beef patty with an egg, avacado and bacon on a potato bun! It was delicious, but I had difficulty eating it by hand as it was falling apart a little.

t37SzKKwz-I5lbERnXucrA.text: Just a great place with variety. Will be going back!!! We had an amazing server by the name of "Fore".  Super helpful and friendly. Prompt service.  Lots to choose from! Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States

5KN2fN9l58zf2XoTsRB87A.text: What goes great with Burgers .... Beer! And not just any beer but really good craft brews. I usually get a sampler. This place is also home of the blue cup. For all the Carolina Tarheel fans out there why not watch a game and drink 32 oz beers out of the famous blue cup. I ordered fries with my burger. They give a large portion. I have tried the garlic parm fries and the truffle fries. I love all things truffle so I enjoyed the fries but thought they could use more truffle. In summary get out to moo and brew and have some burgers and craft beer.

_uysVJu3HyQgL8NtHa5hVQ.text: One of my personal favorites for the plaza area. If you're looking for a great burger and even better service, you've got your place. Make sure to get the firecrackers.

LziGpsNLfnb8a556398zhw.text: This place is awesome!! It was my first meal in Charlotte and it did not disappoint. Their tap beer selections is awesome and the service was great. I got the bbq chicken salad and it was phenomenal! I will definitely be back!

fR7W83s1sBD8gcv8qhh1vg.text: Awesome! Just as expected.. but this time my boyfriend and I brought friends and they loved it as well. There was a 45 minute wait but we just went next door to pint central and got a drink while we waited. I wish I could bring my dog as I saw others with theirs. My dog just wouldn't be able to contain himself. I'll be back for sure.

KtrAXpichI3eqv-BjN8m2g.text: It was good. I was not blown away. This is one of those places where I have no hard craving to go back but certainly have no objection if that's where friends want to go. I will say they do carry Bison at a pretty reasonable price so that is a pretty big plus. No real complaints other than parking can be a challenge.

bztWel4ocDfNN2uf9IdwbA.text: Soo good! I highly highly recommend the cheese curds. I had a burger and regular fries and both were great. My husband had a bison burger with sweet potato fries and loved it. A friend had a root beer float and chicken sandwich and loved both. Great hip atmosphere that we all enjoyed. We will definitely be back!

oUQP4-f7UG8MybFRxHctIg.text: To go order with left over burnt disgusting fries. Burger undercooked to the point of raw in the middle. Nice job guys. Keep up the good work.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thanks Moo &amp; Brew for these burnt, crunchy, disgusting pieces of left over fries. I guess this is what happens with to go orders.

cbneS2VlfWYBf2pzloBj_A.text: Here at Mood and Brew they've really perfected the art of the sandwich, as a result, this place is really starting to grow on me...here's my take on all the Mooin' and Brewin'.  I've been here a hand-full of times since they converted from the old Joe Hoopers which used to occupy this same building.  Since then it has been totally remodeled.  From what I understand, Moo and Brew is owned and operated by the same folks that own He's Not (w/ the Blue Cups) in Chapel Hill.  If you're a UNC alumni, you know exactly what/where I am talking about.    Each time I've been to Moo and Brew I always opt to build my own burger.  I am the kind of guy that likes options and likes to craft a tasty-piece of food-art whenever the opportunity avails itself to me.  With their build-your-own sandwich options, Moo and Brew provides me with a blank food canvas to create as I see fit.  I usually opt for the fried-chicken sandwich, on a Martin's potato bun.  From there, I go to town with all sorts of toppings from bacon, to pimento cheese, to onion straws to avocado - your imagination is your only limitation here.  No matter what or how you build your burger/sandwich it is sure to be served exactly as you ordered it.  Besides the taste, what's really impressive is how well the bun maintains its consistency with all the toppings and add-ons.  Finally, don't forget about the different side and fry options they offer.  Personally, I'm a fan of the parmesan, garlic and olive oil fries.          As I reflect, I really don't know why I don't come here more often.  The service is always great, and they have a great selection of beers.  I would def recommend Moo and Brew if you are looking for a great sandwich and a cold beer in the Plaza-Midwood area.

qHInd0orvS3h5bdKaHn8Lw.text: Tasty burgers with tons of options! GF bun is pretty good too and holds up better than most restaurant bun options. Fries are delish.

8JQdi6QfAwXYSeguIRZKYQ.text: Fabulous burgers! We tried this new plaza place on a crowded weekend night. I ordered the way out west bison burger with the chevre and roasted tomatoes & arugula.  The burger was delicious and I liked the sauce they served with it--mustard like. The sweet fries are yummy too. They also had fabulous beers--my fave Good Morning Vietnam wooden robot!!  Good service too. I would say go a little early or you might wait as they have a small inside space but some outside seating too.   I would like to return and try the farmer's daughter, the bf said it was yummy!    I also tried the turkey burger with chevre, balsamic fig, arugula and it was amazing!!! My new favorite!

nOLg88Rog94VwI-cipEOUQ.text: I ordered the Moo & Brew Burger (rare). It come with Brew Braised Onions, chili , cheese and yellow mustard. I opted for the upgrade ($3) and got the fries Nacho Style. The portions were ample, hot and good. They only have a few parking spaces, so I parked across the street. It was only $3 after 5pm.

Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s the copper bar

79yaUNAwdxOzUU3Ncf9UKA.text: This review is solely for service, or the lack thereof.  My in-laws came in from out of town. They really wanted a burger. I told them there was a place down the road that I had heard served good burgers. So, my in-laws left my home on 5/14 around 10:30pm, in search of a burger. They went to M&B and were directed to the bar to place a take-out order.   They STOOD at the bar for about twenty minutes waiting to be acknowledged by the female bartender. They attempted several times to get her attention, to no avail. The bartender moved up and down the bar (which was not too busy) and never acknowledged their presence- no greeting, no "I'll be right with you," NOTHING. After standing, yes, standing at the bar for twenty minutes, they realized they were not going to get served and left. They ended up going back to their room hungry and disappointed.   The next day when I asked about their experience, they relayed what I just wrote. I was bothered that they didn't ask for management. But my in-laws are nice old people, and didn't want the hassle. I probably wouldn't have sought out management either. After waiting twenty minutes in a food establishment that is supposed to serve all customers, I wouldn't want to complain about (the lack of) service, and then have them cook my food.   I have my suspicions as to why my in-laws were not served that night.  I will leave you with this: - Even when an employee is having a bad day, the customer should never suffer because of it, and - there are far too many restaurants in Charlotte that offer really good cuisine for an establishment to not be on their A game every, single day. I will always opt for the establishment with better customer service.  There are absolutely no excuses or reasons that can be offered to rectify this situation. Hopefully, this customer service issue can be solved with additional staff training, although I have a sneaky suspicion that training was not the issue here.

Debq93oTeuih247kBcVDHw.text: I love how cheap their shots of fireball is here, $5! Their peter piper burger is to die for. Love how they wrap the jalapeno with bacon and have cheese inside of it. The sweet potato fries are a hit and miss. I would definitely recommend this place.

L5mzSQEM13yiEVEJFuqadA.text: I had the best cheeseburger here than I have had in a very long time. Definitely the best in Charlotte. And, it was reasonably priced.  This is my new spot to go to when I'm craving a burger.  Service can be sketchy when it's crowded, though.

L83sKQ7S-i6GfM1SPovCyw.text: This review is based on one visit.  A fun looking place with good service.  We went there a few minutes after they opened. They had a good selections of beers and we tried a few.  When I could not decide on one of them they gave me a sample so I could decide. Kudos.  The food for the most part was good.  One in our party ordered french fries.  They were greasy and inedible.  I suspect the frier was not up to temperature since they had just opened.  The burgers were cooked to order.  I plan to go back and try some other items.

nQygvvQ-Lwn6AxrhFOsfww.text: This has been on my bookmarks list for a long time, finally got to check it off!  Billy was my server, super nice guy who steered me right, and made sure I was happy for my whole visit.  I had the........cheeseburger of course!  How could you not?  And the rosemary fries, total awesomeness.   And I love the inside!  It feels so comfy, like you could hang all afternoon.   This place is a gem, I'll be back for more!

JxlHJnGA0pnKGp5SHN4AfA.text: This is such a cool spot. I had been meaning to check it out for awhile and finally did with my friend yesterday. We were in for lunch and the place was packed with people. They had all of the college games on. They have a lot of good beer options on tap. We got the hop flights. Very cute presentation of the flights too. They have a lot of cool local NC beers on tap. I had farmers daughter burger and friend had the classic with the chili cheese. Both were great. Service friendly. I will definitely be back!

9QLKexXK2d_lIGq4vBKkpg.text: Another great day with good friends, good company & good beer.  My first time visiting a Moo & Brew after spending the last hour stuck in the Corn Maze with a desperate need of a cold beer. A friend recommended MB and so happy they did. With one apparently moving to my area (NODA), I'm actually pretty excited now.  I was surprised by the wait since in my mind it was going to bed just a bar and how wrong I was. MB has tons of beer selections and a great burger and fry selection. Having moved from the NJ/NY area Bare Burger was one of my favorite spots because of the protein selection. MB has Bison burgers! Let me repeat that, BISON! My burger was cooked medium which is the only way to eat a burger and the Angus burger (pilfered off a friend's plate) with the truffle oil fries! Complete heaven!   Ok on to the beers. With it being October, I mean why wouldn't you order a pumpkin beer. I enjoy Sam Adams Ocktoberfest but when in Rome. My waitress recommended the Cold Press which I mean I love coffee and I love pumpkin sounded like a match made in heaven but sadly not a favorite of mine. However the Last Leaf was spot on and very delicious so I highly recommend it.  Our waitress was pretty attentive so A for the service. And thank you MB for taking that Cold Press off my bill, I just could not drink that. Lookin forward to the NODA move. More Bison stories to come!  Check out the art in the bathroom! Love Love love it!  The only negative was I sat outside and there were dogs so I could see hair in the air and if it landed on that Bison it was surely eaten. The host desk is located so close to the door, there was a small line forming that I felt disrupted the staffs ability to deliver food/drinks. Overall great visit and will definitely be back again!  P.S. Can I get some other meat selections? Ostrich maybe, Gazelle. Just to name a few   P.S.S. Met this awesome couple/group who just adopted 2 little babies (twins )who sat next to us! So great chatting with them about their adoption experience and for letting us hold one of them. Ok that is all   Beers Last Leaf (Brown Ale w/ Maple Syrup) Cold Press Coffee Pumpking (Coffee Ale w/ Pumpkin)

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bathroom art, Love Gonzo

VyEkG_JKyUHvulb6aJAOkQ.text: I follow them on Instagram and have been trying to get here for a while and finally made it. I really wanted to try one of the drinks with the food attached to the straw but my attention was averted by a bottle of Miller High Life that passed by while waiting on my table. I have memories of drinking from my father's bottles as a little girl and had to have one. It tasted as I remembered!  Back to the review, I had the bison burger. It was good but I felt it was missing something. Next time I'll either add something to it, or pick a different burger. Overall, the food was great and the service equally so.  I'll definitely go back

tjSj3PfgpQrx4AOx1DpCGA.text: Moo & Broo is my favorite spot to get a burger these days.  I kind of go back and forth between Kickstand and M&B, but after my lunch this past weekend, I think that the quality of beef is better.  The patty was big and juicy.  I usually BYOB - Angus patty, fried egg, applewood bacon, avocado, etc.   M&B has better offerings than kickstands, I am all about the Goodies and Sauces.   On another note and I really do not want to hate on Kickstand, but even M&B's buns are better, fresher and tastier.   If you go, please order the Cheese Curds, you will thank me later.      As I said Moo & Broo is about offerings, choices - nothing is better than an extensive craft draft beer list!   Supporting local breweries as well as some out of state beers.   Awesome!!!!!!!  One thing, if you have read this far...... Parking sucks, get there early, the place is small and fills up fast.   I always have eaten outside, it is nice and relaxing!

8QjJMZeuBrraXwqTKbo7uQ.text: Talk about a nice spot! I loved all the burger options and the decor. Although I don't eat beef, they have lots of  "other meat" options. I ordered the turkey burger and my only compliant was it just wasn't big enough. LOL I wanted more. You get tons of fries that are good. I ordered the sweet potato fries. I also order the cheese curds.. OMG! I could eat the whole kitchen full of curds. The parking is slim so beat the crowd but all in all, you will enjoy it. Cant wait until it stays warm to enjoy a burger on the patio.

Zliz7vs-4B40HKETz_4RNg.text: Let's get the important thing out of the way first: the burgers are phenomenal.   Vastly overlooked is just how cool the outdoor area is at this location. An indoor/outdoor bar that you're able to order food and drinks at allows large groups to hang out outside without crowding the tables.

TgLzx74KiJXs2TdGqV2kMg.text: Moo and Brew is a burger spot that is not to be challenged. The burgers are top notch and so is the service. I have brought the girl here on several occasions but nothing beats smashing burgers with the boys here on any day of the week. Fry selections are out of this world and the beer menu is amazing. Outdoor seating area is great, especially sitting right on central Avenue watching hondas fly over the railroad tracks and blowing out their suspension. After having all the burgers on the menu, I'd have to recommend the bison burger. It's simple, delicious, and gets the job done. Also grab the crew and swing by for Sunday brunch, the large Marge is unreal.

If you love a good burger and beer to go with it this is a great place to enjoy both. The fries are also the bomb! My wife & I lost track of time and spent an entire day at the bar eating and drinking, not that I am complaining!

n-WSAIQXme5o0_EnOkAAPw.text: Why have I not eaten here sooner? I have no idea! I get my nails done right down the street at Tip Toe and they talk about ordering lunch from Moo & Brew regularly. My husband and I tried them for lunch one afternoon and I'm glad we did! We shared the fried cheese curds - oooh, boy! Do not skip these! They were so light and crisp but stringy and chewy. Perfection. We also had the buffalo fries and the BBQ salad. Plenty to share. Next time, we'll try a beer off their extensive menu. Seems like a good place to come hang out in a sunny day given they have an outside patio.

TWi3Ab1nm8KoB5iBooKmRA.text: Local hotspot serving burgers and craft beers.  That alone nearly guarantees success, and if I lived closer would frequent.  I went for their flagship Moo & Brew burger (medium rare since they grind in-house), fries, and a pint of Lagunitas IPA.  The burger was overcooked and bland.  No punch.  I added salt but couldn't rescue the flavor.  The fries were seasoned well and I think my wife would approve  (she's a french fry snob).   Shelby, my waitress, took great care of me.   Thanks, Shelby (who's not from Shelby)!  I dislike the aluminum serving trays.  The aluminum serving tray salesman must have retired by now and has a yacht at the Lake.  Has everyone bought from him?   Joe & Nosh, Mac's, now Moo & Brew and countless others.  I understand nobody wants to scrub dishes; but, where will our next great chefs come from?  Anthony Bourdain, Guy Fieri, and Bobby Flay all rose to stardom having began their careers washing dishes.  Old school.  Clink.  Clatter.  Breakage.  Serve my burger on something of substance or just wrap it in wax paper and stuff it in a brown paper bag, e. g. Brooks Sandwich Shop  Well, I kind went off.  Aluminum is my kryptonite, apparently.  I say Give 'em a whirl.
