jY_hyhporJULbo1hXwDqEQ.text: I built my own burger which ended up being Bison, lettuce, arugula, roasted peppers, pepper jack, pickles on a gluten free bun with an herb aioli. Also got the blue cheese fries. When arrived, the aioli made the burger slide around so much it could not be held . Burger was above average in taste, very juicy but not "amazing". The fries were not what I was expecting but was probably my fault for not taking the time to read the description properly. They were doused with buffalo hot sauce as had pieces of blue cheese on top. Kinda soggy and gross. My girlfriend had the rosemary fries which were pretty good especially if you like rosemary. It seemed to be fresh in flavor and smell. Overall a decent experience. Probably would not venture here again though.

_OkxjwIZkKDBlDkPjNRfyQ.text: A great American burger place with a nice outdoor seating. They have a variety of burgers and even BYOB menus with a number of tap beers. We decided to visit here and try out their burgers. Be warned their parking is limited but there is a paid parking opposite the restaurant where you can claim back the parking fee for bills over 20$.   The restaurant was pretty packed on a Friday evening and they would warn you upfront of the delays in service. But you can ignore that, their service is not that bad even during peak times. We never waited for more than we could.  Tried their Moo & Brew burger with a few beers on tap. Their beers were great. The burger was a let down and bland without any real kick to it. The side fries were better and we ended up relishing on the  fries rather than the burger.  Would recommend visiting this restaurant due to their great location and awesome outdoor seating. The burgers aren't the best tasting but do come here for their beers and sides!

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Moo n Brew burger with loaded nachos fries!

sYcd_nIXp3rum9AHSZUYAg.text: I have to come back to this place. Next time with me dude, maybe my brother. Hell, maybe some friends.   It's a cute spot, cozy. So cozy, my mother and I had convos with a table next to us for a few minutes. Mainly about the service. They were there before us and were annoyed that their server hasn't come back in a long time. Right after we finished joking about the issue, the server comes to their table with two free drinks of what they were having and an apology. That was dope. Sometimes at restaurants you just get an apology. Shoo sometimes nothing.   Unfortunately they didn't like their drinks (mojitos). But mine was slammin!  The Midwood Mule was pretty tasty. While I didn't really taste the alcohol, the drink held its own with the fresh squeezed flavor of ginger. I'd order it again.   Now my burger was pretty good. Could have been a little juicier, as I ordered my meat medium. It wasn't bone dry but it was a little dry. Fortunately, the toppings made up for it. Although, I missed out  on the chili. Yeaaaaa I think they forgot it. But everyone else was good. They give you a ton of fries. That literally is a meal by itself. The flavor was definitely good. I liked the aioli, but I prefer ranch with my fries and they have really good ranch.   Our waiter was really helpful and attentive.   If the parking lot next to the building is full, the one across the street is $3 but they'll take it off your bill.   Enjoy!

kpKO5kaGWS5e9JeqnD9PgQ.text: One of the best burgers I've had!  Great proportion of bun to toppings to burger :). Delicious!  Great atmosphere and our waitress was really attentive and sweet, even making sure our pup got water right away!  We will definitely be back.

d0Vqxp14nzdlEm2MtfOG5w.text: Great atmosphere with nice outdoor seating. But all in all this place is so hit or miss for me... More than once I've received a raw turkey burger. Fries taste good, but are limp and greasy.

dbb_ULPNHWgdzCUoBLULzA.text: We wandered into this place while visiting from Atlanta we went for the bloody Mary which we found out was only served on the weekend but decided to stay since we were welcomed so pleasantly by Zach one of the owners and the hostess brandy who was super friendly. Sarah was our server she was fantastic great recommendations on the menu the food was outstanding and she also recommended other places in Charlotte to eat since we weren't from there

uWXW4evd74Xxw0pYxhHhCg.text: It's just OK. Asked for my burger medium rare but it came well done. The fries are good and there is a jalapeno sauce you can get to dip them in. If I went back I'd probably just go for the large marge. Service is good!

1JhH67Vn6In3nuWIP61a2A.text: Their cheese curds would make anyone's day a lot better. I devoured them as I threw out my goal of eating clean (whoops). My turkey burger was pretty great - I did the BYOB.. tons of options to put on your burger! Sweet potato fries were delicious! The atmosphere was awesome and the staff were very friendly and welcoming! Can't wait to take advantage of their bar that opens up to their deck next time! Definitely check this place out!

QTqI00AmsLYplaM0MKPvMw.text: This was a great little place for beer n burgers.  Food was delicious--try the moo & brew burger! Reasonably priced too. They're also dog friendly which was a huge plus for us!

AVUlVCoS3T1ZtsEXLF7gbA.text: Had the Farmers Daughter with Nachos Fries and an appetizer of warm pretzels and beer cheese.  Wow, everything was a step up from ordinary. Very Tasty and different. Well worth the stop.

v6FeInqceUkUgwzP1CXvEA.text: This place was awesome. Stopped here for a drink and ended up ordering a beer flight. The staff were so friendly and helpful, the beer selection was great, and the environment was very well done despite the small area. Definitely coming back soon!

CGGE-kKuxe4hm6nJURa_cQ.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had. Love the variety they offer with types of meat, bread, and toppings. The bison is amazing! Plus, they have pretty much any beer on tap you could want. Bartender was very knowledgeable about each of their beers. Great burger joint and a good place to take in a game.

EalTS6eziZ-xahfbKbgnHQ.text: My friend and I ventured here for a late night beer/food and to watch the panthers game. We arrived around 9:30 PM and it was pretty busy. When we sat down at the bar the bar tender was very attentive and helpful and we quickly ordered. Around 10:00 PM or so the atmosphere completely changed. The music was became so loud we couldn't talk. The food however was one of the best burgers I've had in Charlotte. SO, if you like really REALLY loud rap music and a place to watch the game (without sound), this place is for you.

mxNKSR_JkOnYH74paaoV8Q.text: Worth your while if you're in plaza.  Fun spot.  Good beer selection, good burgers.  Which, given the name, is probably what they were going for.

_lySPAKHHHgrkymsd0feuQ.text: Pretty average. There was no wait for lunch, and our server was prompt and friendly enough. The burger was good, but nothing to justify an $11 price point - added the fry basket for an extra $3 went with the chili cheese and wasn't impressed. Regular fries were decent, but a tad cold for my liking. Parking is a nightmare.   Seems to have a good beer selection though.   I still think Bang Bang is the better option for grass fed beef - and it's also reasonably cheaper.

TGVn0h_5m0YDIPOGYbjgmw.text: Omg everything was amazing ...good food awesome service this place is was awesome !!!!!

xLvk45FPrRRdEcts6QRchA.text: Best burgers in Charlotte. Excellent beer choice and friendly attentive staff. Pack beware, this is Tar Heel country.

7bqqpESQyj5YAcofNZ31yw.text: Had dinner here tonight it was my first time here not really the best experience due to lack of parking and the weather was bad and storm was coming in the area however we thought we had a good hour before the storm came so we sat outside because it was a 30min wait to sit inside our server was nice the issue didn't come in until the weather started to get worst right when we got our food the wind really picked up the umbrella we were sitting under even collapsed on us and man at the table beside us had to help us dust from a near by construction site and parking lot kept getting in our eyes it just wasn't very enjoyable the food was ok fried green tomatoes are good my burger was good it just got cold very quickly due to the wind my moms burgers was wayyy over cooked and they left the chicken off my sisters salad after charging us for it but i might be willing to try this place again maybe

3cE1iJqzOeTKqME3c75RGw.text: Smh where do I start? Horrible wait staff! I witnessed a fat guy with a gray beard with disgustingly dirty clothes during peak hours handling fully cooked ready to eat burgers without gloves!! I nearly vomited at the sight of this disgusting troll touching my food!! The beer selection is a D+ it seems like they think they know good beer but don't!! The neighborhood isn't safe i found out the day after I ate there someone was shot during a robbery in the parking lot! Stay away from this awful place

KKkPbluyJUl3xgO23ctgQg.text: Mediocre at best. Service was good and that's why I'm bumping it to 3 stars but the food is easily a two. I could make better burgers, their patties need to be seasoned.

0Nsku0BZ8ylb9jDLKiG4VA.text: Parking is definitely insane and pretty impossible sometimes so uber if you can or walk. The concept is great, the beer is great, and the food is awesome. I don't like burgers and never order them but decided to check this place out.. it was great. The burgers are amazing and unique. The ingredients are perfect and really cater to those who like different things like goat cheese rather than just bacon and cheese. I highly recommend. I didn't give it 5 stars because the attentiveness could be improved by staff but overall it was well worth it

qy-2MvmL9BmImZwvAGDrLg.text: Loved the Farmer's Daughter burger. Had the buffalo fries.  A bit more than I was expecting. Great flavor, just more than I wanted. Flight of beer was nice touch. I will be back.

cEasMhp9BlH2DkHp5yDeDw.text: I have to say that the margaritas were the best I've ever had. Trust me I know! I have been drinking margaritas for many many many years and I even make really good margaritas and these by far are the best in Charlotte. Also the bartender which I forgot his name was great. He was very personable. So if you're in the neighborhood stop in to get a good burger and a fabulous margarita

Pk_cM2oTMdBrrnX4504mJA.text: Delicious. I had the Produce burger with beef patty. Cooked perfectly and taste was amazing.   My friend had the bison burger. Lots of strong flavors. He gives it two thumbs up.   Beer selection is great too.   I'd say beer is probably on the higher price range for drinks. Food prices are definitely reasonable.   Staff is very friendly.   Will be back.

x7RZyu4wU1Ah1RzxpcWshA.text: This is a great burger joint! The staff was very friendly, and my burger was very good (farmers daughter). My husband wasn't too happy with his choice, he got some type of beer burger. I will say that if you love the taste of beer, you may love this burger. While he is a beer drinker, we didn't like the stinky pungent taste the beer added to the chili and cheese. overall we had a great experience, and we definitely will be returning.

IGri8859RbgPLu4gLezpbw.text: My boyfriend and I always say we were going to try this place and it's always packed and can never find parking lol. Finally we did. We both got a build your own burger. Which were both lacking in seasoning, didn't have a hint of salt on it. I had the sweet potatoe fries which were good. He has the truffle fries which were awesome and with the garlic aioli sauce.

LYq2_oEElr91Bn8p3Hv_8A.text: Had a few drinks at the bar.  Good beer selection and friendly bartender.  Would definitely go again when I'm back in town.

24bBxIRkak96Nnf3Jl7oSA.text: I've heard a lot of people mention this place over the past couple weeks so some friends and I decided to check it out. Beer selection was great but the only good part of our meal was 1 of our appetizers (cheese curds). Burgers were pretty bland and not very juicy. Fries were really greasy but somehow still bland. Overall a pretty basic flavor spectrum; nowhere near the caliber of some of the other burger joints around.

ypk-wwrYYq6WH8qxvQ59kA.text: The rocking turkey burger was the best burger I've ever had. Smack yo mama good!!!!  The vibe is cool, Amy is awesome (ask for her) and the options are great!  We happened upon the place by accident. Best accident EVER!!!! Don't miss this place.

qTzY1Mu6-8BWffaJ1c9sXw.text: By far the best burgers in Charlotte! I don't get too experimental with my burgers and the classic tasted just perfect. I also love that the portions are decent and not exaggeratedly large and they have beer flights to try some of the local brews! The wait staff was great, too. They should add some umbrellas for shade on the patio. The day I went there was not shade and it got pretty hot by 1 p.m. I was glad I was able to get a spot under cover with my dog. Oh, and parking can be quite a pain in that area, too.

9Xhm5fxLkN7crRZsdDpqTw.text: As far as burgers go, zero complaints except for that I want to try everything on their menu. Sweet potato fries are fire. Inside was a little loud for us and there was a smoke issue (someone was outside working on the problem) but their front porch is great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Create your own: Angus w/ pimento cheese, house made pickles, LTO, M&amp;B sauce and those sweet potato fries

THC1SZ3kih4yPuhUnQziVg.text: The service and the food is nothing worth bragging about. They may be worthy of 3 stars. What killed my opinion of this place is that they added $14 to the tip. If you pay with a credit/debit card, definitely triple check your statements. I would recommend to anyone visiting Charlotte to stay clear of this establishment.

iX3F3rtfzmnS9ZDSd58Myg.text: Moo & Brew was pretty good, I wasn't blown away by any standards. I do have to say, their beer selection is incredible- but the burgers were ok. The size was mediocre for the price, but the beer was delicious.

Fddz3DnMWr9Wmq8BcRpyrQ.text: Let me start my saying I have been going to moo and brew since they opened for their bison burger and they have the best all natural bison burger in town, arguably the best in the state! I have only had a couple of mishaps with Togo orders and any faults were fixed up and the service was amazing here EVERY TIME!!! The hand selected beer list includes several of my favorites which keeps me coming back for my favorites. I will keep frequenting this establishment as the service, quality of food/drink, service, and management is too notch comparatively to any other paces I have been to in Charlotte!

TgFDbqquDhnx9ENooPsx-A.text: Burger wasn't anything exciting. I prefer Bang Bang Burgers but the new outdoor seating and many windows is nice.

49tOFdjQIVj-kJdl_mTBkg.text: Searching for great burgers and great draft beer so decided to give M&B a try. Lots of delicious burger and draft beer options - this place was just the ticket. Nice casual place with a nice diversity of patrons. We totally enjoyed it! Agree with Chad E.'s review.

fjudpgNEoS58lwa_CEzsVw.text: Just finally tried this place and wow was it good. Service with a smile and great food. The fried green tomato app was a little pricy for what you get but the sauce that came with it was really good. Tried the seasoned fries and the sweet potatoe fries and both were great. They also offered a shocking amount of great local beers. Burger was great too. Will be coming back for sure.

FEiMNnaD0ZmNoEFByBEE_w.text: Great food.  Fun place to hang out and have a few drinks and food.   Cheese curd for starter rocks!  Great selection of beer on tap.

YKK4J-y3gcMVrDRRGqQctg.text: I'll start off with the good. This place has a nice atmosphere but the service was subpar. As for the burgers, if you are going to call yourself a burger place you should probably make sure you specialize in burgers. I didn't even come close to finishing mine it was unevenly cooked and the flavors were just not there.

ItLltEaYUHezgpqLPERSpg.text: Wow! What a delicious treat. They know how to cook burgers perfectly, here! The flavor profiles are very deep. I love that you can substitute your side and the protein on your burger as well as the bun. The service was outstanding. They accidentally left off an extra avocado on one of our burgers so they didn't charge us for it yet they still brought it out to add onto the burger. I love the beer flights; lots of options and you can mix and match any four! The size glasses within the flights seem bigger than most flights, too. I really recommend the Jive Turkey burger. I subbed angus for the turkey but I bet it would taste great even with the vegetarian option or as is (with Turkey)! Lastly, the owner was so friendly. On our way out, he introduced himself and asked for our sincere opinions. We'll definitely be back!

oF6SWgA_Acwdr_FdSZWGRw.text: Moo and Brew is a restaurant/bar with a dive bar feel. They have gluten free and vegetarian options which is awesome. The veggie burger isn't bad but it's definitely not the best and it falls apart when you eat it. Unfortunately this seems to be the norm in the Charlotte area though. I can't speak on the real burgers. The apps are unique and pretty good and the different fry combos are my favorite thing about this place. Great beer selection. And service is always on point. Seriously, I've never had bad service here. And the staff is always really nice and friendly.   Overall the great service, the vegetarian/gluten free options, and the relaxed atmosphere are what keep me coming back.

274cAqiYpt5tn_N58cC5TQ.text: What more can I say about this place other than the fact that they do right by the name "Moo and Brew". Zack, Ian  Ken always have a great selection of beers on tap that constantly changes and pushes the envelope. The burgers are delicious and cooked anyway you like them with whatever toppings you request. TRY THE CHEESE CURDS!!!!!!!  The guys knocked this concept out of the park and I am excited to see the concept replicated in NoDa.

P0-J3KMxtUVQCif9lAqNXA.text: The fact that you can build your own burger or chicken sandwich makes this place all the better.  Although the set menu is pretty incredible too!  The burgers are HUGE and absolutely how they should be-messy with a side of awesome.  If you do make your own sandwich, might I suggest a buffalo chicken base with the jalapenos and ranch.  Love this place and can't wait to go back.

pvnj-i0zuyhT8T8D2yzlng.text: A definite fun spot to hang with friends or eat a burger with your date. They've got great workers and a great spot to entertain. When the weather is nice enough they have a wonderful patio to eat at and a side patio to drink at.   The name says it all though! They've got killer burgers from spicy ones to eccentric combinations. You can of course create your own too. They are now offering a CBD inspired menu too if that's something you want to try out!  The brews are in abundance too! They have great prices on PBR (gotta stay hip in Plaza Midwood) but they have so many other draft choices plus cans and bottles for days. Check them out on their social media. And stop in for a UNC-CH game if you are a Tar Heel fan!

vP6xpClhGlNv-ciAhYPiPQ.text: Sooooo this place is cool. I liked the vibe probably more than I did the food. It's not that the food isn't good or anything it's just not memorable. It's basically another burger spot. I did enjoy the beers. It's a place you should at least try but it's not a regular spot.

FLsk1Op7zIQ_BiWxX7PXQQ.text: Honest opinion here this place is for the College crowd. Loud talking with everyone trying to be heard over the next table. Now for the food: we ordered cheese curds for an app-they were good, but really greasy...tasted like funnel cake batter. I order the old trimer and added bacon. It was "eh". Nothing great. You can tell this is a premade burger slapped on a grill...lacks any flavor unless you drown it in ranch to get it down, bacon was extremely salty and my burger was undercooked to the point I could not eat it. My sweet potato fries were way over cooked and tasted burned. I could not even eat the meal. My Hubby got the farmer's daughter and it was undercooked as well. He said it was "ok". His fries tasted a heck of a lot better than my nasty, burnt sweet potato ones. All in all a bad experience. As I sit at the table writing this my stomach is already rolling and trying to revolt on me. I foresee a miserable night ahead.

BroiXm0Z9RneEpYRmKRJkw.text: I want to say I didn't bother speaking to a manager because if the guy at the front door isn't friendly, I'm sure the manager isn't.  I do normally like the food here. But it's not good enough for them to be so inconsistent and not helpful.   I joined the waitlist on YELP... P.S. first experience with it and never will again. I was told 5:45 would be time and 13-23 minute wait. I got here at 5:34 they clicked my name on the computer and they told me it was going to be a lot longer. I said there's only one party ahead of me. They said that was based on the table. I wasn't asked to select a table? Find me a different table. Idc.   The guy never apologized, never cared. Was super rude. My 9 month pregnant friend, in the party of 5, and I walked all the way here based on the waitlist.   So they have tables outside on fake grass that are apparently first come first serve. I asked if they would serve us there. They said nope.   If this were my business and I gave a time, I would take care of my customers and ensure they were happy to come back.

-xXYqfAW4ce1beEL03cQSA.text: Neat little place. I would call it a hipster burger bar. Pros: Great, friendly service, fun eclectic menu, many beer choices that I've never even heard of before. Neutral: Had the pimento cheese and hummus app. Pimento cheese was awesome but the hummus and cheese crackers were overwhelmingly salty. Cons: Rosemary truffle fries were overpowering with the taste of rosemary. Peter piper burger could have been much spicier. They need to put at least one beer on special every day. Not just PBR and Tito's shots.

TYPkTW_IrqFCfTQQ-GHZyg.text: This is a cool place to go. It isn't a big place but that makes it more special. They have great burgers and beer (hence the name.) The fries are good as well and have a couple of "fancier/upgraded" fries. I got the spicier one and they had some heat to them but were not over powering. My was hoping for a special kind of beer they were out of it but our waiter brought over a sample of a similar one that she liked and ordered a glass.   The night we were there the Food Network was filming which was awesome to see. We talked with the crew and could see what the camera picked up from where we were sitting. It was neat to be apart of that experience even if we wont be on TV.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States

9Ued5y1vRG4aEdy6CHUn7A.text: Local. Playful. Variety. Outdoorsy.  We went today for lunch, mainly because we knew they had a bomb patio and oversized adult yard games (which we needed given it was a sunny, winter Monday). Anyway, the burger was just as good as the patio, so I'm told. I had the "fresh produce" which is the only vegan option on the menu. I wasn't disappointed with the only option and the fewest potato fries were top notch! The beer selection was healthy and well rounded. This place gets me jazzed for the spring and summer!

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States

pvF1R6q-KFoiPqqhwJrLbA.text: I've never even thought this before but I kind of wish I was hungover for our brunch visit last weekend. Why? Because everything was delicious and greasy and would have been the absolute best after a night of drinking. It was still an enjoyable experience even with a clear head.  There's literally one reason I drove all the way to Plaza Midwood for brunch - the Large Marge. My friends have taken pictures of meal Bloody Mary's and for years I have been jealous and coveted them. This weekend I finally had one and it was everything I hoped and dreamed (and the only beverage I have ever posted on Instagram).  The great thing about the Large Marge (other than being a delicious drink) is that almost every appetizer is featured on top. Trying one of everything is my favorite thing - ever. The cheese curds were a little disappointing (would have been so much better fried) but everything else was amazing. Fried picked green tomatoes - delicious. Jalapeno popper oozing cheese - obviously yummy. It looks like the slider was previously sold between grilled cheese buns and is no longer sold that way. Sadness but still delicious as a normal slider. Carrots and celery thrown in to ease my guilt. Oh and it was served with a miller highlife. I haven't had one in years but it felt fancier being served out of a small glass bottle.   My group also ordered an assortment of appetizers to share, and by far my favorite was the fried cheese curds. My fiance let me sample his turkey burger and it was delicious. I ordered a side salad since I basically had a full meal with my drink but wanted to balance it out a bit with something green. It was pretty large considering it was a side and the ranch tasted fresh.  If you've been thinking about the Bloody Mary go and get it. It even comes with a souvenir glass to take home. The samplings of food I had was worthy of a return visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large Marge!

g39QhQFz-3GMazglIJ0-dA.text: Very cool place. Stopped in for some day drinking. Impressive beer menu and our waiter was knowledgeable. They have a nice covered patio with TVs.  My friend had a burger which looked great.

rEfjiCWFw8Yvx5-naCX0cw.text: It's exactly as it sounds- burgers and beers. And they do a damn good job with both.   This place is one of my favorite hangover cures. For starters, I like the Jalapeno Firecrackers (I mean come one, anything stuffed with cheese and wrapped in bacon) and the Midwest Cheese Curds. I love all the different fry options. Why Nacho Fries (loaded nachos but fries)- yes, hells yes. I get a different burger every time I come here pending on my mood. Big fan of the turkey and bison burger options. Don't see one you love? You can build your own. Bonus: you can also pick your bun (Martin's Potato, Wheat Bun, Gluten Free & The Skinny).   Moo & Brew is home to one of the most IG-worthy drinks in the city: The Large Marge. It's a meal in itself- 20 ounce Bloody Mary, topped with a Jalapeno Firecracker, Wisconsin cheese curds, two grilled cheese sandwiches, a burger, fried green tomatoes, bacon and a shot of Miller High Life on the side. If you're a UNC fan, this is also the only place here that you'll find the He's Not Here big blue cups.   This place is not huge inside, but it does have a nice patio. Fire up your Yelp app, you can check to see if there's a wait and put yourself on the list.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Backyard Classic

DY7u9Z7Tocla5CPP1z31SA.text: Meh. The bar tender was less than friendly. But it was lunch rush. Either way, hire a little more friendly and lively staff.   The menu is to the point. Burgers. Salad. Sides. The food is WAY over priced for the quality of food. I paid $11 for the brew burger which had zero flavor except for mustard and onions. The chili was bland. The cheese was, cheese. The fries were just fries, I didn't get the fancy fries.   The beer selection is good. I'll give them that. But for the price... 1 burger with a side and a beer, total was $20.  Not really worth it in my opinion. Atmosphere is nice though. I'd go back for a beer or cocktail but not the food.

MPDx3UGTXvgN98ymmb376g.text: Here are the highlights- the food was great, beer selection is great, and our waiter was spectacular. If it hadn't been for our waiter looking out for us - this would've been a two star review.  We arrived and waited a solid 5 minutes before someone came to seat us. Hubby thought host may have been in the restroom but several people passed us and could've said someone would be with us soon. No one gave a crap that we were standing there waiting. I was on the verge of leaving when host showed up. We sat outside so we could watch the game. The bigger patio only has one TV so keep that in mind if you are there to watch sports. Inside and smaller patio has tons of TVs so great place to watch games. Hubby says that the beer selection was vast but heavy on the IPAs. He's not an IPA guy but found some other selections easily.  We ordered the Farmers Daughter and the Mushroom burger. I got a salad as a side and hubby got the buffalo blue cheese fries. My burger was cooked perfectly and salad was great! Bun was excellent (you have several basic choices for buns including GF) Large chunks of cucumber on the salad but I liked that. Hubby's fries were cold- seriously?? I love fries but they gotta be hot ya'll right?  He struggled thru them but I left them alone.   I decided to order the Rosemary Truffle fries for 'dessert'. Server came to tell us it would take a bit longer because the first batch they put up were cold and he sent them back. Thank goodness for my server!! Fries came out piping hot and let me tell you they set my world on fire!! Those Rosemary truffle fries with the magic sauce for dipping- BEST I'VE HAD ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD!!!   Our server was on the spot with extra drinks, sauces and lemon for my tea. Friendly without being stalky.  Seems this place could jump into the stratosphere if they just had better management keeping an eye on the front door and the fries. Such an easy thing to fix it almost makes me angry at the 'meh' attitude of management. Side note- there was a couple who brought their dogs seated on the patio so I would say you can bring your four legged friends.  Side note 2- the restaurant is located right beside a railroad crossing. If the train comes through, brace yourself. The train whistle is so loud it will rattle your teeth and almost blow your head off. I can't believe the dogs didn't freak out. We were there for an hour and a half and the train only came once so not something that happens consistently.

EjBgL9G5qw4sFOWN77iKdA.text: You get a good Moo and a good Brew here.  In all seriousness, the burgers are juicy and flavorful.  I usually get a Backyard Classic and add some mushrooms to it.  Sweet potato fries are always my go-to side; however, I have heard their regular fries are amazing.  When it comes to beer, they are always rotating their drafts and like to venture out on different beers.  I like going there for the variety of beer choices.  I can get a flight (they do 4 beers) with a sour, a wheat, a stout, and a porter if I wanted.  Love this place for a solid burger and a good beer selection!

1pRtLKHHLOG_ATsXwOAyjw.text: What an experience, decided to try this place and what an experience it was. Try the moo & brew burger, what a great unexpected taste that kinda caught me off guard for how delicious it was. This burger is a must have if you stop in this area.

prlutVlWiYHWu2Tx8djnjQ.text: Fun environment and good food!! Patio areas the best with great views. Pretzels and sailors are my fav!!

OPLyavxmtWIo0bj-UHNDJQ.text: This is my favorite turkey burger ever! The fries and the service is exemplary! They also look out for loyalty. Today I stopped in for my lunch and Natasha and Barron bought my lunch just because. Thanks so much for your attention to the little things. I will be back again and again

j7OZHF5Ei8kfHbcuLE-EXQ.text: Great atmosphere, kid and dog friendly.They have a great beer,wine, and alcohol selection. The patio seems to be a popular selection while dining.Our server was awesome and very helpful when it came to the beer selection and food choices.We ordered Midwest Churds,Backyard classic, the Wild Alaskan Salmon burger and Rosemary,Truffle and Sea Salt Fries.The burger,fries, and curds were delicious.The salmon burger was good but I most likely will not order it again.This is a place I will definitely visit again and I will be bring friends along.Oh and I loved  the music selection.

yNpmWU3_yccA2MfHhrqsRA.text: Good burgers and good beer selection. You can't go wrong here if that is what you are looking for.  Vegetarian or vegan? This place has something for you too. I got the Fresh Produce Burger, which has a vegan black bean patty instead of meat. Veggie burgers are usually hit or miss with me, but this one is actually pretty good. They also have salmon burger and turkey burger options, which I will have to try next time.

NWIW-BJ2DrgW5N-601Cnhw.text: Neat name, too crowded...  not so sure there's anything I can remember... not a fan...

kuyfsyYj0Qv3fw4OC8RZng.text: Moo and Brew has the best burgers in Charlotte. You can tell the quality of the burgers are amazing. They also have the best loaded fries. The nacho fries and buffalo fries are my favorite! The selection of beer is awesome since they have a ton of draft beers with all different styles.

9oRF62i8WyzrRNqm2GeJCw.text: Awesome burgers and great service! Great selection in craft beers and burgers. You can create your own or just pick from their specialty burger menu.

RWxIrhoyt1U8J7PK7kQxyg.text: I know why this place is called moo and brew... I think my burger was still moo-ing when I got it was so raw!! 4 of us dined here and 3 of our burgers, which were all ordered medium, came out rare-med rare. They were not good at all... we ended up leaving without eating it and heading down the street to mid wood! The manager did comp our burgers but nothing else on the bill. Won't be back.

rMg3BSNMVSjbDvyus_M5Pg.text: Blown away with the remodel from the former Joe Hoopers. Atmosphere is more inviting and clean. Our Service (Jesse and Yolanda if my memory serves me) was beyond terrific and the food was honestly delicious. We ordered a Copper River Salad and the Jive Turkey burger and both meals were prepared correctly and full of fresh ingredients and flavor. We will absolutely be back!

47l83dCZqnhlYup-q3pVSA.text: Originally told a 30 minute wait for a table but it was much faster. Service was great and quick. Although the menu is small, there is something for everyone. Great selection of local brews.

55nG8fH6lMbjdbwxuGqKMw.text: I just love everything about this place. Read other reviews for specifics...  I would just say - come on over and try it, they are doing some GREAT stuff here!!

EmNmBhRB6zDdebqjVPD4TQ.text: Newly opened place on Central Ave in Plaza.  Name says it all...35 draft beers and build your own burgers with a choice of beef, chicken, turkey, black beans, bison, or salmon.   You craft your burger from the bun up.  They have 6 different types of types of topping for your fries too.  You won't be disappointed if your a burger, fry. And beer junkie.  They have have both inside and outside seating and a full inside/outside bar.

Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States

HgLWSGgUuW7qHHwvfPD2cA.text: Delicious burger. Seriously. Amazing flavor with melt in your mouth 100% Angus patty. Hand-made, so it takes a  little time... But they have a plethora of tasty beverages to help you be happy while you wait for the awesome taste explosion you will soon experience.   Super friendly staff and a cool vibe...and my puppy loved hanging on the deck.   We will be back.

386YTsU1Z_4_ENmLjQbZ6Q.text: We would go back. The patties are kinda thin if you are super hungry. I was okay with it though. I might be the only one who did not like the truffle fries. They just tasted like Rosemary fries to me. I had the plain fries and didn't really care for them. The Bloody Mary had a slider on it and came with a mini miller high life. Looked amazing! We didn't get it, but saw it from afar. The beer selection was great. They do have a good variety of toppings and sauces. I would go back every now and then, but not often. The service was great! Waitress was super nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build your own. Pickled tomatoes on the side are yummy.
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Farmers daughter
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rosemary truffle fries. I think these just have truffle seasoning. Too much Rosemary.

Pmsduq6O-v7z0ldAzrpm5w.text: I absolutely love this place!! I eat here pretty much every week because I can get a wholly nutritious meal that I don't feel bad about.  Their Angel Fire Cobb salad is my go to, with mixed greens and kale as the base, topped with an assortment of vegetables, avocado and healthier protein options like the bison or grass fed beef burgers. And the beer selection is always on point!  The staff is friendly and competent and the bartenders remember that I don't take ice in my water (I like to sit at the bar if it's not nice enough to sit outside).  They have a large covered patio for outdoor seating, which makes this place 5 stars in my book :)

eTyJo-R216odGslesdTISQ.text: I debated for a while if this should be a 3 or 4 star rating.  I ended up giving 3 stars because the burger was ordered medium and was almost well done and the fried green tomatoes were very greasy.  There were some good flavors here just not executed to the level of 4 stars.

dhLyMw4gr4zOofqUbKxJhw.text: Food was really good. I got the piper burger. It was delicious! The garlic fries were awesome..  Drinks were simple and good. (Midwood Mule)  The service was a tad slow being new, but we enjoyed our drinks relaxed.  Only complaint is it is super hot inside. Next time I will sit out side. Not sure it they didn't have the air on or if it was the door opening, but it was not comfortable.

YNJTwW9NBdmZaqw326Iacw.text: I would probably give this place more stars later down the line. Only this low because of the service was a little messy and I know it is a new business.  FOOD was really good. Got the breakfast style burger. Loved the flavor of the bacon and the burger was juicy. The special M&B sauce wasn't bad. My friend got the Big Marge which did take a while but was pretty good.  SERVICE was only ok. I wanted to add avocado and have the sauce on the side. Neither of these things were done. It took a minute to our server's attention. Took even longer when we were done and trying to get a box.   Not exactly deal breakers with the service since they weren't being rude. Overall, I'm sure I'll go back.

kwGhjW8qtAOaZuYecAOzbA.text: I had the Peter piper. The jalapeno firecrackers were good. But there was a hard bit in the burger. I hate it when that happens. Besides that the sweet potato fries were blah. Soft and no seasoning. But really you should only go to this place if you are ok with SUPER LOUD restaurants!

UB9N965nhSnw6h6ADH0l4g.text: Moo & Brew may be the ultimate beer and burger joint in the south. The Wayout West Burger was phenomenal with some of the Bison meat I've ever had. The fries are also in a level of their own. I had rosemary truffle fries that could be a meal just on their their self . If you are looking for a place with a generous selection of craft beer from Micro breweries across, this is the place to go. The beer selection stretched from Wicked Weed to brews from Texas. I will definitely be going next time I stroll through Charlotte.

W9rzULmNHrDDgED43squxw.text: Best turkey burger in Charlotte - hands down. Also love the fact that they are on No Wait!

-rgFMzwFo_HXbThusXPwzg.text: Huge draft beer selection! The burger was just okay nothing fancy, got the moo&brew. Loved the hummus and pimento cheese. The pickled fried green tomatoes were weird for me because it was sooo sweet.

JEKC69d5bvMDe3CqY8aOug.text: I preplanned lunch for this place based on previous reviews, and I'm so glad! The service was excellent despite it being packed. The beer selection almost made me cry with happiness. And the food was outstanding - I got the Moo and Brew burger, and it was perfectly messy. My husband and I spilt the Bleu Buffalo fries, and they were delicious.

a5jJYI1qFWfBVAoClpOzdw.text: I was so excited... posting pictures of the Large Marge and saying "I'm SOOOOO doing this!!" To everyone. This was so incredible. I think it goes down as my favorite specialty dish I've ever ordered. GET IT!!!! I'll start with how awesome it looks coming out, every person in the room let out a "oooooooo!" Once you take all the pictures and start actually figuring how to dissect it, you are so giddy like a school girl with al these little things to try!! Let me list: a slider burger.. plenty big, and thick! Cooked nicely medium..pressed between 2 grilled cheese breads, a bacon wrapped jalapeno popper, thick slice of applewood bacon, cheese curds, olives, carrot (like half a whole carrot!) celery, a few olives and as if there could be more, it comes with a side small bottle of miller high life! This is all atop a 20 ounce perfectly spiced and flavorful Bloody Mary. Did I mention you get to keep the cup????? I couldn't be more excited. It was a meal but the only thing to top it off more was the best sweet potato fries anywhere... thicker cut to really taste the sweet :) get the herbed aioli sauce and honey mustard and pull up a chair and stay a while! The only reason I don't give 5 stars is the burgers ordered at the rest of the table were ordered medium and medium rare, but were quite medium well... that just makes me sad, a great burger should be cooked properly. But, just get the Large Marge!!

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s large marges for Mother&#39;s Day!
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greatest sweet potato fries!
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. She&#39;s beautiful!!! Large Marge!

oemQ1Ih-6dDIz2VfaM6_Ew.text: If you're looking for a fresh greasy burger then look no further. I had the Moo&Brew burger, it was so juicy and perfectly cooked. For the side I got the why nacho fries which basically has every topping you could possibly think of for nachos but on their famous fries. I highly recommend this place! Customer service was great and the food was amazing. What else could you ask for?

gdwWMkHU0chtE-EvAUeddw.text: This place was just meh. It's really small inside although it looks like the outside area is very nice, but it was too cold for sitting outside. I ordered the Peter Piper and it was just ok. I have definitely had better burgers. The burger was on the smaller side and just lacked flavor. Even with all the jalapenos on top it wasn't very spicy and just didn't do it for me. The fries were just ok as well. I had expected more because this is a burger place but was disappointed. I doubt I will come here again.

1MuUwnI36fYL32wK9axXJA.text: I had a REALLY great experience! Before I talk about the food, big shout out to Billy. He was our server & did an AMAZING job! He was super pleasant, funny and genuinely nice. There was an air of calmness about him that was rather relaxing.   My friend and I went on a late Monday afternoon. It wasn't busy at all. Parking will either be on the street or the baby sized parking lot on the right side of the building. They have an outdoor seating area, but we opted to sit inside because the way heat and humidity has been lately- nah.   I chose to build my own burger. I got a turkey burger, but doubled the patty, wheat bun, provolone cheese, lettuce, tomato, and an over medium egg with a side of rosemary, truffle and sea salt fries. They do not skimp on the fries. I'm rather greedy and I couldn't finish the basket! The aioli sauce is good with the fries. I had that & ketchup with my fries.    The turkey burger was daggone near perfect. The patties were thick and seasoned well. The bread wasn't too dense and dry. I had the M&B special sauce to dip my burger in, which was really good. Totally recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States

QGXDphgq3bopVkg4kRxdPQ.text: Putting it straight down on the table, I don't see what most see in this place. It's like any other bar, with a more diverse burger menu, but food of the same caliber. Cheese curds, greasy and cheesy like you'd expect. On the undercooked side and all balled together into one big doughy cheese lump, not so much.   The burger was dense, and came out well done when I had asked for med rate. The patty was super thick in the middle and thin on the ends and grey all the way through.   Id rate it next to a 5 guys or in-and-out for my west coasters.   Definitely not for me.

1y-9R8l0Rvn1FPID6tkBzA.text: This burger bar is really great! Friendly and knowledgeable staff but the star of the show are their burgers. I have ordered the farmer's daughter burger twice and it was wonderful both times. My husband got the Peter piper and he enjoyed it.  Unfortunately I have to remove a star for a misunderstanding. We ordered and told our waitress what fries we wanted, not understanding that only the special fry flavors are extra and come in a big basket. She did not make sure to tell us that the burgers only come with their regular fries and the others are additional. It was definitely our fault for not reading the menu more clearly but I feel that she should've mentioned it to us. We paid a hefty price for fries we couldn't even eat half of. With that said, the rosemary truffle and sea salt fries are bomb!  Will be back!

tv8QGk2JGZHoKU9rKqH6rw.text: SOLID burgers, we all really enjoyed our food. The beer selection is substantial too. No one had anything they didnt like and we had 5 people, all of which ordered differently - some burgers, some salads, all types of fries :)  We sat outside which is really nice with a dog and there is a TV out there for games. We will be back for sure!

bEsES2XU-ilJ_iBuk-goHA.text: Lunch date with my hubby. We dined about 12:30 and there was no crowd. There was plenty of seating both inside and out. We chose inside as it was blazing hot outside. The waitress greeted us warmly and took our food order. Menu was ok- and the food came out fairly quickly. I tried the burger with chili and the chili was not flavorful. The burger itself was juicy. I did like the Parmesan fries. I would visit again if someone asked to meet there but I would not suggest this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Moo &amp; Brew Burger and  Parmesan. Garlic &amp; Olive Oil fries

XKqmLCgGVnGNa06q8hgX8w.text: Yum!! Came here for a late lunch and they weren't busy. We got sat right away at a high top near the bar area. Our server was friendly and pretty on the ball.   I got the BYOB. I got grilled chicken with pimento cheese and some toppings and I added fries to my order. The prices really aren't that bad! I got a side of ranch with my fries. The fries came popping hot and not salty at all. It had a good flavor to it. My chicken was cooked perfect and it wasn't dry. The pimento cheese really added that kick to it. I love the BYOB option because you can try different things and they don't skimp on the toppings.   Overall, great experience! I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger with fried egg and fries
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot fries
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled chicken with pimento cheese

MzgyF1la8h1UkOZ7xCceuQ.text: Last night we came in with another couple after the YEE Bubbles & Badges party. My husband and I decided to share a BYOB (build your own burger) and a basket of the truffle fries with rosemary and sea salt. The burger was delicious but I wish that it  had been cut it in half for us because they knew we planned to share. It's very difficult to cut these burgers in half without losing half of the toppings. The fries were well seasoned, however, they were saturated in oil. So much so that the cardboard basket they came in was soaked as was the table below. I have never seen that before. The portion of the fries was also smaller than previous orders and smaller than the couple's that we were with which was odd.   We have been here more than 6 times in the last year and I find than I am getting a bit disappointed with the inconsistencies of the fry game. I've also ordered coke slaw on my burger several times and only received it once which is aggravating.   Earlier review: This was my 3rd visit here and I really enjoy Moo & Brew burgers. This time, we brought friends and they said this was the best burger they ever had, and they LOVE burgers.   The price is pretty good for what you get but I don't think I will order the "skinny bun" again. Also, I found it a bit ridiculous that I had to "build my own burger" to get the "Fresh Produce" burger for cheaper. I asked to sub-in a 100% angus beef patty for the black bean patty, having already done the math that it's the same price to build my own. The waitress informed me it would be a $3 up-charge. I don't remember this from last time, but it's been a while. The "fry game" basket of fries was good. I ordered the Parmesan option, but I was disappointed at the amount of Parmesan that didn't make it past the top layer since they say they are hand tossed in a bowl. They were tasty but I asked for salt and pepper which wasn't delivered to our table and I would've liked it for the fries missing Parmesan.   Something else that was frustrating with the dining experience is that when we arrived there wasn't a waitlist on Yelp (we had been monitoring). The host was getting a table inside ready for us and a server (or another host?) came up and sat a couple there! We ended up sitting outside and the guy who made the mistake said "if it starts drizzling come inside immediately so you can get a table inside" so when it proceeded to drizzle, I went inside and was informed that table was being saved for another party. I found this ironic since our table was given away.  Due to the mix-ups through it the evening, I am removing a star from the review. Moo & Brew wasn't that busy to be mixing up like this and I was really annoyed to have our table given away and then be sitting outside while it drizzled on us.

5kuVnZVAq2mmzzbYQFcNsA.text: So what's the best way to celebrate a Birthday then seeing a report on the Best Bloody Marys in town. And I like Bloody Marys so off to Moo & Brew for a little Large Marge. I cant do it as much justice as a picture or the YouTube of it being made.  Let's just say you can call it a full brunch in/on a glass.      And you get to get the glass.  Fried Green Tomatoes were some of the best anywhere. The slider on my drink was delicious. After the first bite i said I will be back to get a burger.  Fast and very friendly but not overly so.  Place is smaller then I had thought so there will be waiting at times I'm sure. But everyone is always moving and getting it done.    I left off a star because I have had a better Mary. Just never such a cool one.

TVKj3O29gtZpGm1EGiYDFg.text: Moo & Brew is a great go to spot for fun, food and drinks! I have been multiple times and have enjoyed their outside patio, while sipping on some good cocktails. I love they have an open order window when your enjoying drinks outside.  Service is always on point and they have some great bar bites, including their Cheese Curds!

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese Curds and Pretzels with Beer Cheese !

4Z8XNSMCxGIe6b8fJL4S8w.text: My husband and I finally had a chance to try Moo & Brew one Sunday night for dinner, and I believe they are better than Bad Daddy's.  We started with their cheese curds.  Made with gooey white cheddar cheese, they were good, but I don't think we'll repeat them, as the portion size was too big for just two people.    My husband had their namesake, the Moo & Brew burger, served with onions, beer cheese, chili, and mustard.  The chili was spicy, the cheese was gooey, and the burger was cooked to a perfect medium rare.  I had a make-your-own burger, with grass-fed beef ($3 extra), cheddar, avocado, and buttermilk ranch.  My burger was also perfectly cooked to a medium, and was very juicy.    My husband's burger came with a side (mine didn't), and we shared his generous portion of hand-cut fries.  They were cooked well and nicely seasoned, and we both enjoyed them.  We also enjoyed our burgers, and here's why we liked them better than Bad Daddy's - Moo & Brew actually cooks the burgers exactly as requested (Bad Daddy's can't seem to get this right), and the buns sufficiently held up to the toppings (another failing of Bad Daddy's).    We'll definitely be back!

mNF3oY-_eRO08Mb8cfjI8Q.text: Earlier in May we was gearing up for the annual Moo & Brew fest and of course we had to visit Moo & Brew and get down on some grub. Every single time I HAVE to get the Midwest cheese curds ( cheese freak over here), with the sun dried tomato ranch YUM!! We also went with the BYOB burger( build your own burger) also a great option to try new additions to your burger. Mine had angus beef, tomatoes, Bibb lettuce, pickles, jalapenos, PiMENtO CHEESE , diablo mayo & the sun dried tomato spread. It was so delicious!! Check this place out ASAP! #cltliving

XV5uvcp7zL4Sxt6ZAaMJ8w.text: Flew in for their 3rd annual birthday bash, place is pretty amazing. They had a stage set up right outside the bar, area blocked off and was vending local brews. Didn't try the food but four stars for the live music and the locals. Will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Little Stranger

kvLmy8YaDIOtCkE3WnSsdQ.text: Went here for the first time and it was awesome. I was a little skeptical at first because the menu didn't have very many food options. I expressed this to my server Billy and he got me right together with suggestions!!!! I ordered the BYOBurger (grilled chicken and sweet potato fries). The chicken was so flavorful and the customer service was superb. Billy did an excellent job with recommendations and checking on us to make sure we were satisfied. I will be going back with more friends!!

0-8lQheirMIWWuNi8v39nA.text: This place makes a strong contention for the title of best burger in Charlotte! The thing I like the most about this place is how they let you customize your own burger with a large variety of different sauces, meats, fixings, and even different types of buns. The moo and brew sauce is especially tasty as is the diablo mayo. In addition to great burgers they have a large variety of beer and a small but cozy atmosphere giving it a True neighborhood pub vibe.

xefGCuzLNNnTuMbi-6qEEA.text: This place has this laid back yet hip vibe that I really appreciate. They have a variety of beer selections that can tickle anyone's fancy - and food to balance out the experience. Their burgers are delicious and the side salad is very generous in size.   I love how the bathroom is unisex and very clean. The place can get packed and the noise a bit loud but it's absolutely worth the wait.

szjv-iyUg87_c9BVUmjBvg.text: Food was great, and we hardly had to wait for it eating at the outside bar. We were really pleased with the service and the experience there--and bringing three small children, sitting outside was a good idea. We will definitely be back!

dz0qRoSesuJoBNLGGrLgOQ.text: Today is National Cheeseburger Day! It happened to be my first time there as well. I have never seen a menu that offered Martin's Potato Buns before and it makes a great difference. The brew shrooms are a must to add to your burger. They offer several sauces and toppings. I will definitely return.  The rosemary truffle fries were not skimpy on the rosemary at all. They are paired perfectly with the herb aioli.   If you are interested in local brews they have a vast amount to choose from and they have flight options for tasting.

kourdz3VJyxBAKiCHnLTtQ.text: I was lured in after seeing an Instagram post about National Cheeseburger Day and I'm so glad I did!   I got the angus beef burger with pimento cheese on the potato bun. It was perfect. I got house pickles and picked jalapenos on the side. I got the rosemary fries which were heavy on the rosemary, but really delicious.

xAEaAfi7IHLQz5Lc6ZRWyg.text: I love Moo & Brew! They have a great selection of drinks. I had the prickly limeade which was really good. I also had the brew braised shroom & Swiss burger which was delicious...and the rosemary truffle & sea salt fries...omg so good!  would definitely recommend.

So good that I forgot to take a pic of them. Twice. The last time I had good cheese curds was when I was in Milwaukee.   They have a huge selection of draft beers and a nice outside area. This is a good spot for food or just drinks. Service has been excellent, everyone here is super friendly. I'll be back!

2qbbWOX6O0S6eKD7HjoNZA.text: Went here on a Saturday night and the food was just "ok". I didn't wait at all to be seated because I made reservations on the Yelp app. I had the Backyard Classic burger with Sweet Potato fries. The burger itself did not have much flavor and I could make a better burger at home. The bun looked like something straight off the shelves of the local grocery store. The Sweet Potato fries were not good at all and I love Sweet Potato fries. The fries were tasteless. My boyfriend had the regular fries and they were much better. Customer service was good and they had a lively crowd. After eating at some other great hamburger joints in the QC this spot just fail flat.

nq7Sm419g4Dn0-7r7UC5Ag.text: Food is awesome!! First time visiting Charlotte and this place did not disappoint, honestly one of our best meals down here - blows some fine dining (cough, Fahrenheit) out of the water and reasonably priced.   Definitely a fan of spicy burgers and the Peter Piper was amazing  server Diamond was friendly, knowledgeable and super helpful for picking things out, rosemary fries were awesome as well, such a cool different taste in fries. Sweet potato fries served with honey mustard is also a great combo. Overall ingredients were fresh and delicious.   Awesome beer selection, a ton of local stuff which great.   Decor is really cool too, would say old school meets new school for a burger/diner type place.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peter piper burger and rosemary fries with herb aioli

Kk14v0w9Soq19PfNjQftvQ.text: I enjoyed myself so much here. Came here with some friends. We had a small wait so we put our name down and headed to the thirsty beaver. A lady there said the Bison burger was amazing! We got the text that said our table was ready so we headed over and sat down immediately. I browsed the menu and decided I couldn't pass up the bison burger. Glad I chose it! It was flavorful and delicious! I also ordered the parmasean garlic olive oil fries, they were delicious. I couldn't even finish them because there were a lot! The service was great! Our server made sure we had everything we needed at all times. The only, and i mean the ONLY thing I didnt like, was the small water cups. I felt like I was taking shots of water. LOL! Overall, we all enjoyed our meals and plan to return soon!

jIWjKrM01DUrdKFIKWdrpw.text: Just ok.   We tried the fried cheese curds, they tasted just like fried mozzarella sticks so nothing special there.     I had a basic cheeseburger, it was pretty good - I have no complaints. My wife had the Shroom and Swiss and she didn't like it at all.  She thinks it was the sauce they put on it, she couldn't get past the smell. It had a mold/mildew type smell to it. She tried scraping it off but in the end she just couldn't eat it.   The fries are ok, but again nothing spectacular, some were soft and some were hard like they were under cooked.   This place isn't bad, I did like mine but it's nothing special. Meaning I'm not dying to go back but if friends wanted to meet there I'd be cool with it but on my own I'm not in a hurry to return.

hVonPpgcHcuAk-uLZBArxw.text: I really like this place, for the first time in a burger, the cheese was completely melted. I ordered Moo & Brew burger and sweet potato fries as a side and I really enjoyed my meal. The atmosphere of the place is really cool as well. Definitely recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Moo &amp; Brew burger with sweet potato fries

Am2ntskm3MbKWPIVBTwJrg.text: Well, we tried. Yelped in our join the waitlist, so much for that. I don't think they pay attention to that. Said there waas 1 party ahead of us, went in and said it would be another 20 min. They need to get it together. There are a lot of other places to eat ....

WC5lN75DKhSYrOEz_CtnYw.text: Went to Moo & Brew for the first time yesterday on our Friday date night.  We were really pleased with the staff, the atmosphere and the awesome food.  We do plan on coming back for sure, and may try the Large-Marge Bloody Mary.

ccIqLnDSZwWCGjmE_P0Eug.text: Great food and equally great drinks (beers and mixed).  Really flavorful burgers. So many ways to customise and a variety of meats to select from-turkey, chicken, bison, salmon, and more as well as a variety of toppings to make it just right for individual tastes. Waitress are sweet and attentive as well as management- hopefully this stays even after the newness goes away.  Parking can be tough -may have to do side street or across the street as their personal parking lot is very small.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Try the apple pie! Didn&#39;t think I&#39;d like it because it was cold vs hot. But ate every crumb!
Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soo good forgot to take picture before it was halfway gone.

89nS8L-iq2AAesD1KZyzHw.text: Been here multiple times and never been disappointed. I'm picky when it comes to turkey burgers so I was a bit skeptical ordering for the first time, but they are great! Their salads are also worth ordering. Don't forget to order their $8 beer flights!

zbfPEzXQarvLXUoKXTKQ9w.text: I'm impressed! We were looking for something different in the plaza area. We drove by and the staff seemed so happy to see us. They knew and loved their new restaurant here in the plaza. Great menu of draft beers. Hoping they add a little more brown or red beers soon. But, the burgers... Wow! I had the Peter piper and it was delicious. The bread held the burger the whole time, the meat was tender and scrumptious, the hot peppers squirted with such joy. I would jump over a toddler for this burger. Zack, the owner, was extremely attentive and made sure we were happy with every thing. We may of made this our local go to place to have a burger in the plaza hood. Thank you and we support you.

photos.caption: Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States

lQRcdJrbljyFAaK1fg1hxg.text: I've been here a few times now and I've had a mix of experiences. I think the beer selection is great and the menu is diverse! As a pescatarian (only meat is fish), I still found a good number of food options that all sounded great! Unfortunately like most, the black bean burger didn't hold up very well and was messy to eat, but at least it tasted good. I want to try the salmon burger in the future. As for sides, my first time there we all upgraded our "fry game" and I ordered the rosemary truffle and sea-salt. I found it a little too salty and oily for my taste. The next time I ordered regular fries and they were just fine. The atmosphere is good as well. Overall, not bad and I probably will go back because it's a casual place to grab a beer and food with friends.

15belPbqxLwEulRbdxM-_A.text: I'm not making this review because all of the staff was friendly and knowledgable, I'm making this review because I had the best salmon burger I have ever had here and I want everyone to know that. The Rosemary and herb French fries were also so good, my family smashed 3 huge baskets.  Our server, Aimee, was great and so sweet. Elijah was a really cool dude too and had great recommendations.    Parking may be tricky during busy hours but it's worth the trouble it may be. Awesome look, awesome vibe, and most importantly awesome food.  2 thumbs up from the whole family! (That's 8 happy thumbs total)

PWzGdyNKFBmFRt9ImABoxQ.text: Their burgers are to die for! I love creating my own with the wide range of toppings you can chose from. The prices are very reasonable for the portions you get! I've also received excellent service every time!

z8nOCYeoFBErer6lLwDDNw.text: Awesome local beers even awesome service!! JESSE is a awesome waiter, had a great time. They have games and turf outside. If you can't tell this place is awesome by the amount of times I've use the word awesome then you're not awesome.....

_PbkGNez020GiMvFUlR8vQ.text: Moo and Brew is awesome! My roommate and I frequent Moo & Brew a few times a month. At first I was a little put off because I'm not really a fan of any of their premade burger options and I couldn't figure out the best way to order their fries. I've recently started doing the BYOB (Build Your Own Burger) option making the exact burger I'm feeling during that visit. In addition, I ask for cheese on the fries and I am never disappointed.  The wait staff at Moo and Brew is super knowledgeable about their large beer selection, which makes choosing your pint or flight so much easier. The flights at Moo and Brew are very cost-effective and gives you a great opportunity to try new beers if you're unsure of what you want.  Love the Plaza Midwood location and looking forward to the new Noda location they recently announced.

3lDd39wQr52Gjn8oAmpJHA.text: Never have had a bad experience here. The cheese curds are a must get, and so are the nacho French fries. I always get the Peter Piper burger but have had others and they always cooked to perfection. They even have a skinny bun option! Not to mention Tito's Mule on tap! I can't wait until they branch out into Noda!

R8Uk7aAbmYCmTvvbaIQKcA.text: Always wanted to try this place. Came in today and awkwardly stood around for ten minutes with no acknowledgement of my presence. No one said a thing to me, tried to seat me, nothing. Will not be returning

2bmZDsKAwp3TheIKf8UyWw.text: I had lunch here today and it was delicious. They have an extensive beer list and a small, but yummy burger menu. If you don't like any of the combinations they chose for their menu, you are welcome to create your own! I ordered a veggie burger and added my own toppings to it. It did not disappoint! If you are in the area and looking for a quick meal, this is a great place to choose. Bonus points: it has a large patio!

-EQynxlMZKsn6-XtJul91g.text: Best sweet potato fries I've ever had, hands down. I don't know what kind of sorcery they do to make these so good, but I'm not questioning it.   I've been here a bunch of times and had a slew of things. I appreciate the fact that they let me get my burger as rare as I'd like without judgement... yes, I'm willing to risk it, and no, I don't care. Neither do they. Service is always great, ask for Jesse or grab Kaitlyn at the bar. Peter Piper burger is a good go to and it's not nearly as spicy as it sounds.   Their beer list is also awesome. It's always updated with a crapton of good local stuff and a few harder to find items. They also have prosecco on draft and a badass patio if you're feeling brunch-y.

B74SHvMyRqB7ekrJx0sBXA.text: An unsuspecting restaurant. This is a great casual place to catch some games. The menu is completely burgers and appetizers so there isn't a ton of variety but the food does not disappoint. Their sweet potatoes fries are some of the best I've ever had. Their beer menu is expanse and full of variety. Not a place if you're looking for more than a house type of wine. Recommend if you're in the mood for a good burger and beer

n26F5g5zZ3IAvneDuza_fQ.text: What a warm inviting staff this place has!  It all starts with the host, he was so helpful in finding us a table in which I could watch the game I wanted.  It was an appstate game so a little off the radar but they found it and put it on for me!  While we were waiting on our table we got a beer at the bar, what an incredible beer selection they have!  Masterfully curated with local and regional selections, many of which I have not seen in other places.  Someone on staff knows their beer and secures the very best for this spot.  We were lucky enough to meet the owner Matt on this night and he could not have been nicer.  He gave up his seat for us, shared his fried pickled green tomatoes and bought us a shot as well!  On to the food.  I ordered a build your own chicken sandwich with white American, bacon, pickled red onions and herbed mayo.  It was just incredible.  The chicken was crispy and cooked perfectly.  The bacon was crispy too!  I loved the potato bun and the pickled onions just made it a masterpiece.  I may go back tommorow just to order this sandwich again.  The fries that came along with it were nice and crispy, well seasoned and just perfect.  Service was impeccable and the food was outstanding, what more can I say!

p4MLEiLX2pWeibVLz4pq2A.text: I am a burger freak. I just am. I am a snob about it, and I understand that it can be super annoying. That being said...Moo & Brew is good. It was not great in my opinion. The burger was not a memorable one, and while the fries were also good...I would not crave those specific fries again. The craving part is important! I got the burger with jalapenos on it, and while the toppings were good, and the meat definitely cooked medium like I requested...the actual meat was bland. So saddd. Ikub4RaTiBJcx_a53aF6yg.text: The owner Zack was great, he even gave me his flannel shirt because it was cold and started a bonfire. The manager David friendly and marketable. Mama bear behind the Bar was awesome too, she picked two great beers for me and my wife.   BUT the younger two female bartenders on Friday Feb 10th were trash. They only responded to the guys making disgusting remarks to them at the end of the bar. I would have liked to have been asked if I would like a menu and a starter item. First time we have ever been to Moo and Brew, they could have sold us more on the food options for the limited menu.  My recommendation is to never sit at the bar unless the noticeably older lady is working. Not that she looks old but she's a stinking good bartender. And has a lifetime of knowledge, both in good beers and in good service. That gets you much further than some bimbo in booty shorts who doesn't know the menu. I don't like to say never but I would be hard pressed to return. I wish I would have just got a table, and had a great ending to a great start. But the crappy bartenders destroyed any possibility of that. Hope Zack and his team continue to do well, and that these two bartenders dont hold them back from success. Good luck buddy!

BEST TURKEY BURGER EVER  I'm not sure how they get it to taste so good but you should definitely try it too.  I also loved the fried green tomatoes. RArfU9bdWiP6ojE41jKz3g.text: Where do I begin...It was a hot Saturday afternoon when I had a real hankering for a delicious mouth watering burger. I wasn't looking for some flat patty frozen burger from some cheap chain restaurant but an authentic burger. Where else better to go than Moo&Brew.   I'm coming into Moo&Brew with a hefty appetite ready to devour some apps., drinks and burgers. A slight wait but definitely worth it. We had two orders of cheese curds that were absolutely phenomenal, the cheese melted in your mouth making you want more. The spicy pork grinds tasted like that were right off a pig frolicking in a patch of habaneros. The sweet tea flowed like water. Now for the Peter Piper burger with some nacho fries. The mouth watering burger with a little less kick than Bruce Lee was great for someone who likes heat but not too much. The nacho fries were alright but tasted more like chili cheese fries with a dash of Hispanic flare on top.  I highly recommend checking out Moo&Brew!

UMVkt1G3Ya75_YKhG3y1vg.text: This edition of Excited about Eating takes us back to one of our favorite neighborhoods in Charlotte, Plaza Midwood, and to Moo and Brew. This burger spot offers "Tried and True" burgers, salads, and a variety of different types of fries.  For our appetizer, we selected the Midwest Cheese Curds, beer battered and served with a tomato infused ranch dip. These curds were great, crispy on the outside, hot and gooey cheese on the inside. The only negative was the grease left in the bottom of the tray. Dora here. Grease? What grease? lol. I wish they'd have come out before our meal. Then we could've enjoyed them more before filling up on our burgers.  I chose the Moo & Brew Burger, braised onions, chili, cheese, and mustard served on a potato bun and upgraded the side to Parmesan, Garlic & Olive Oil fries. This thick and juicy burger was outstanding, with hints of a smoky flavor in the chili. However, what stood out about this meal were those fries. A giant size portion and crisp, with just the right amount of oil so that the parmesan stuck to each fry.  I think I could have made my whole meal out of these fries. Worth the upgrade over the typical fries.  Dora here. You know how sometimes you're just craving a juicy burger? Today was one of those days. We both just wanted a burger, and we'd been eyeing Moo and Brew for a few months now. I like that they offer a "Build Your Own Burger" option. They loaded mine with beef, lettuce, relish, bacon, bleu cheese crumbles and aoili. Messy but YUM! Soft bun, fresh ingredients, just YUM. ~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog

L6NQrBs0SxjpjGZJFQTwsA.text: Best burger I had in a while...... I mean that . Wish I took a picture, but I was soo into enjoying the momentum of eating . If you know what's good for and want a real hamburger. Gooooooo here also get the curds you'll thank me later.

a0H1F4I9XZVoPJiZ_TOKvQ.text: My boyfriend and I finally had the opportunity to check out Moo &a Brew and let me start by saying the whole night we were continuously wowed. That's all we kept saying to each other was wow this is amazing! My go to appetizer at most places is fried green tomatoes and since there isn't much you can change there (except the dipping sauce) most places are good but none really stand out until I had the pickled fried green tomatoes at Moo &a Brew. They are stand out for sure, I even saved a few and put them on my burger! We also had the cheese curds which were paired with a really great dipping sauce.   My boyfriend got the Peter piper burger but upgraded to the bison which he loved. The burgers are pretty big and I think he ate the entire thing in about 5 minutes, after both appetizers! He also upgraded his fries to the loaded nacho fries and he loved them.   I ordered the fresh produce burger with a side salad. The burger was really flavorful which seems to be a challenge for most people with black bean burgers but they definitely packed it with a great taste.   Aside from the food the service was great. I believe our servers name was Christina (that may not be right I'm not great with remembering names). She was very polite and took great care of us.   Of course I have blabbered on about the moo but the brew is just as great. They plenty of locals and a few not so locals as well. They also have a Winter Mule on tap made by one of the owners and the best way I can describe the flavor is Christmas in a glass. It was absolutely delicious and I would come here just for a mule if that's all they served.   All in all this place has it going on from the food and drinks to the atmosphere and sheer cleverness of the brand. I'll be back for sure!

Vpjv0xMgTLuV8wPsQu5zOQ.text: I can't wait to come back here to try the other burgers. First experience here was awesome, and I didn't even have beef (although everybody at the table said that their burgers were excellent). We started off putting our name in, and we were told there would be a wait, but feel free to grab a drink. They have a specialized patio for pre-dinner drinks, where there's a sliding glass door from the inside for the bartender to hand you your drink -- excellent :)   We were sat in the amount of time promised, and given the menus.I decided to try out the Rocket Turkey which was excellent. Their goat cheese wasn't too tangy, fig was awesome.. and the turkey was like melt-in-your-mouth delicious. I decided to up my fry game (hell, everyone at the table decided to up their fry game) and go with the buffalo fries. These are SOAKED in buffalo sauce, which was great for me, but I can assume it would be a turn-off for others. The lady ordered hers with Rosemary and Truffle, which were also delicious and came with an aioii that I want to put on everything in my life.  I need to come back here for a beef burger, but the point is, I'm excited about coming back. This was a great spot to check out, until next time!

If you're in the area , don't hesitate try them !

UzWETAvaJi739L-mcg1sFw.text: Found this place online a couple weeks ago while searching for a tasty and obnoxious bloody...it lived up to it when we were in town last weekend! bkuOd9lb_9JbSxxe-H_lPQ.text: Moo & Brew is fast becoming a hipster's delight with all of the high-density housing coming online. The service is hit & miss, big time. You may be greeted & seated by some ambivalent hostess followed by great table service. Or vice versa! Bumped up to 3 stars only because the food still kicks ass. Please get a handle on the service-side of the business before it goes down the tubes like Kickstand did.

dgiFlDemO9ESnDuWFyjC9Q.text: Pros: I highly enjoyed my customized burger and large marge! They have done great redecorating and dividing up a small space to make it feel more welcoming! I think the place is improving but still has a ways to go! I did enjoy my experience but hope for improvements as they work out the kinks!   Cons: Large Marge took over 18 minutes to get, which I understand it has cooked items but they should figure out a better system since I watched the bartender stain a drink that had been sitting there for ten minutes. Our drink was very watered down so the garnished were really what you were paying for! Suggestion is to out the fried green tomato and bacon one the burger! My burger was also overlooked! I still highly enjoyed my burger but I ordered MR so I expect some red which it was barely pink!   Suggestions: provide shading for patio! I wanted badly to sit outside but with medal chairs and no awnings it was basically impossible!!! Also I suggest working on a system of service for the Large Marge since it is such a point of interest!!!
