gShZ6gZHPmsOAXmZ2m_KmQ.text: Went here for lunch one Sunday and had a great experience. There was a wait but Moo & Brew is on the No Wait app which is very convenient- you can get on the list without having to be at the restaurant!  We got there a little before it was time to sit down so we sat at the bar and had drinks. The bartenders were very nice and knowledgeable about the menu.   I got the Large Marge which is a Bloody Mary with a cheeseburger slider in between two grilled cheese buns (whaaat?!), a stuffed pepper, cheese curds, bacon, and a ton of other fun stuff! It was $18 but is basically a meal and drink in one. I was amazed at how good the little slider was!   I ordered the BBQ chicken salad as my entree and could barely eat it because the large marge was so filling- but what I was able to eat was very good- the fried cheese curds were a nice touch!   Overall this place was fun and the food was tasty. I will definitely be back.

DMtyaIB8ZWh0sLQZ7JfCEw.text: Finally made it to try the Large Marge, due to a page on my EWP #CLTFoodiePassport, and we definitely went home happy. Moo & Brew not only ranks up at the top of burger options in Charlotte for their food, but the people watching and patio make for a great experience.   While I was sad they had run out of the tall skewers for the items included with the iconic photo-worthy Large Marge Bloody Mary, it still hit the spot on a nice Sunday afternoon at 2pm. Their Fresh Produce burger was a good lighter option and the rosemary, truffle, and sea salt fries were savored while sipping on a sour beer.   It was especially nice to walk in right when a small table opened up outside that was both in the shade and against the wall, which allowed for a great environment for our toddler to not have to sit still during the meal and not get into trouble. Our server kindly brought a smaller water cup with a lid and straw, so great job on service.   There are obviously plenty of other places to grab a burger in town and even in Plaza Midwood, but if you want a relaxing environment with a solid portfolio of craft beer taps, Moo & Brew has it dialed in.

FsI5jMZgWGOMZKhwMWAwEw.text: Moo & Brew is a Bar and Grill in Plaza Midwood area in Charlotte. It is a small bar and grill with an outside patio. If you are going on a weekend night, I suggest getting a reservation or going early and having a drink or two at the bar. They have many different types of beer (none of their own-brewed in house). For a starter, you must get JALAPENO FIRECRACKERS, which are Pimento Cheese Bacon Blanket With Buttermilk Ranch. For a main course, you can get Burgers and Salads. If you aren't a fan of the specialties you can create your own. Tons of options to put on your BUILD YOUR OWN BURGER. They also have chicken, Vegan Black Bean Patty, and other options for those who don't want beef on their burger. Great place for a casual night with friends!

B7MI-v1PCIu68sUTd9Lg7Q.text: Ehhhhh not my favorite. I've always heard of this place because of them specializing in burgers and beer, now granted I'm pescatarian so this is no burger review per say but as a whole the place was just okay. The restaurant is soooo tight not much space to move around and typically a wait because not that much seating, which led us to sit at the bar. I ordered the salmon burger with sweet potato fries the burger could've been sooooo much better without this dill pickle mixture they added to it. I can honestly say it ruined the whole sandwich. My favorite piece of the dish was the sweet potato fries and I was kind of jealous of my friends truffle fries as well. I did sample a few beers and the bartender recommended more for us to try and I will say I was definitely satisfied which says a lot because I typically stay away from beer and just choose a cocktail instead (but you can't go to a beer place and not try the beer lol). Overall, the service was good they were nice but nothing fantastic and the food was mediocre; I would only return if maybe in the area and couldn't find anything else

AK0EsouvifoVZqfjM1kjwQ.text: Sweeeeeeet potato fries are why I will keep coming back! This place has the BEST, crispiest sweet potato fries ever and they're so plentiful. Yum.  Also the veggie burger, even though the patty was a bit crumbly, was delicious when made vegan! I hope Moo & Brew gets some vegan sauces, like vegan honey mustard. (I. would. die.) And vegan cheese! Then I would really love this place and it'd be even better.

0nR1MlBBRUDLqCyqCS0OsA.text: I was never in a rush to try Moo & Brew, to be honest, because I thought the name was dumb AF. I'm glad I got over myself and gave 'em a try, though, because they've quickly become one of my favorite burger joints in Charlotte.   I've sat on the patio and inside and I've felt comfortable either way. The service is quick, charming, and helpful.   I would be doing Yelpers a disservice if I didn't share this: get the chicharrones. Get a double order. I'm so serious. They're absolutely perfect, and the flavor is exceptional. The honey lime drizzle is a revelation.   I've been pleased with every burger I've ordered at Moo & Brew. I'm especially glad they have a gluten free bun on the menu.   The fry sides are also delightful. The Bleu Buffalo fries can end up a bit soggy, but the Rosemary Truffle Sea Salt, the Parmesan Garlic Olive Oil, and the Loaded Nacho fries are all excellent. I've also had the black beans as a side. The flavor is good, but they're too spicy for me. Stick with the fries.   Parking can be a pain, but I think that's come to be the way of life in Plaza Midwood.   The clientele seems to skew toward the bro crowd, especially during the brunch hours. Be prepared.   I'm excited to hear about the upcoming NoDa location; I hope they can capture the spirit of the original and find success on that part of town.   In summary: Chicharrones. GF buns. Truffle Fries. Go.

SZOgn-9oE6NgrwdQfe8Nvg.text: We decided to finally check out Moo & Brew before out kickball game on Monday. Such an awesome decision.  Moo & Brew has a nice outdoor patio with some seating indoors as well. Parking is a bit difficult but we managed to snag a spot of the street.  I ordered a Wicked Weed IPA.....cant remember what my husband got. The beer list was pretty extensive and there were a good many that I don't usually see on the beer list. They did NC proud with their selections! I also noticed they have a flight for $8 that includes four pours.  We decided to split the Farmers Daughter burger with the rosemary truffle fries. The burger was perfectly cooked and I loved the combination of egg, bacon, cheeses, and that sauce! The fries were fantastic! Nice sized portion and the aioli served with it was a nice accompaniment. So glad we decided to split as we were so full after!  Excellent burger spot and addition to Plaza Midwood!

7EWl2jRBHr2weiu9NFc87w.text: The turkey burger was so flavorful! The server was really nice but not overly excited. The fries had a really good seasoning. Can't wait to go back!

EcmOqpofj4kL8HK5_Lwakw.text: Just okay for me.  Wasn't sure how to rate this place either as a bar or for the food.  It is a good bar with plenty of local beers and I would give that part good reviews although it is kind of small inside.  I can tell by the burger and fries I had that the food is not bad but also is typical bar food.  Nothing special here, plain and simple. Probably will be back for drinks and that's it.

Photo of Moo & Brew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice flight selection

ss9XvpY8DWmrFWX-NcECTg.text: Great patio overlooking Central Avenue! They have a lengthy beer list including many local drafts. You can either build your own burger or order one of their creations. They also have options like salmon, veggie burgers and salads. The fry options are really creative too, nacho, buffalo, rosemary truffle, etc. I can't not get the peter piper burger. I love all things spicy and this burger is topped with bacon wrapped jalapenos for crying out loud! The pretzels with beer cheese are great, and so are all of the fry varieties I have tried. I will say, things can really add up on the burgers if you're adding things and upgrading fries and before you know it you've got a $17 burger and fries.   Moo & Brew is also the Charlotte UNC Bar. Finally got to make it there on a game day to watch the National Championship game and was very impressed with how well they executed a busy night. Our server was awesome, constantly checking on us and food and drinks came out quick. They set up the seating to maximize viewing and make it comfortable for everyone! Definitely reccommend for watching a Carolina game, or just when you want a good burger!

MxjWa0Sw8kVV1YwZoiincw.text: Visited two times now and cannot believe how good their food is. The best place to go if you need a burger and fries fix. Enjoy!

cQ2XlLFAXmVWv2eJo9nW2Q.text: This place has improved significantly from our first experience! Service was much better this time and I even say that on a busy Friday night! We got the Nacho Fries with the chili on the side which was s a great choice for a larger appetizer that can be shared! Their beer list is pretty expansive with a great selection! I even have to give a shout out to their greeter for having the most awesome sleeve tattoo - he has all the characters from the movie "The Labyrinth"!

yBn0bglv5XdqZFHFmOEN7w.text: Don't know what all the hype is about! Don't get the rosemary fries ... ew! Turkey burger is okay but still dry if you ask me. The atmosphere is about the only thing going for them.

V17v8mSMiFR3KyhTGThZ-Q.text: Not the best service. Sat at a table beside the managers having a meeting and they did not notice we were not being taken care of that good. The burgers were great but the French fries were poor. The quality of the fries was poor because I think they are just frozen and fried with seasoning on them. The beer selection is really good.

_g8yZy51msOZD-8KPPQGXw.text: Walked from my apartment this past Sunday only to find out the Patio was closed due to being understaffed. For less than two weeks of being open, this restaurant should have ensured that at minimum the restaurant was staffed properly for the weekend.
